loan.name: Lanza 4 Group

texts.es:
Gloria is 34 years old, has two children, and for 8 years has traveled to the city of San Cristobal in order to buy clothing. In the beginning she invested in 30 or 40 pieces of clothing, now with her loan and earnings from sales she will invest in buying various styles and sizes of clothing. She belongs to the group called â€œLanza 4â€ along with Gabriela H. H. (who sells refreshments), Flor de Maria A. Azuna (who sells clothing), Julieta M. L. y Adregonia O. L. (who has a grocery store).

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

DOÃ‘A GLORIA TIENE 34 AÃ‘OS, DOS HIJOS. DESDE HACE OCHO AÃ‘OS VIAJA A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL O COMITAN A COMPRAR ROPA AL PRINCIPIO INVERTIA EN 30 O 40 PRENDAS, AHORA CON SU PRESTAMO Y CON LAS GANACIAS GENERADAS CON VENTAS ANTERIORES INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA EN DISTINTOS MODELOS Y TALLAS. PERTENECE LA GRUPO LLAMADO LANZA 4 JUNTO CON DOÃ‘A GABRIELA H. H. (VENTA DE REFRESCOS), FLOR DE MARIA A. AZUNA (VENTA DE ROPA), JULIETA M. L. Y ADREGONIA O. L. (TIENDA DE ABARROTES).

loan.use: Purchase clothing

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alternativa Solidaria Chiapas (AlSol) - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Bar Biova Group

texts.en: Bar Biova is a group of 4 people who started a restaurant in the central market of AdÃ©ta, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers from LomÃ©, the capital of Togo. The popular Bar Biova was created by Abra A., 42, her son Koffi Gros A., 18, and 2 of Koffiâ€™s friends, Noutala D., 20, and Dovola V., 22. This tight-knit group of family and close friends opened their restaurant in the center of the bustling marketplace, a location that allows them to attract hungry customers as they doing their weekly shopping. Bar Biova specializes in â€˜Fufu Agouti,â€™ a traditional Togolese dish made from yam paste in â€˜Sauce Agouti.â€™ Agouti is a tasty groundhog-type animal that lives in the forests of this region of Togo. The patrons of Bar Biova hope to use this loan to purchase more yams and agouti to increase their production and to, in turn, use the profits from their business to provide for their respective families.

loan.use: To purchase more yams and agouti (ingredients of a popular Togolese dish)

loan.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Herlinda, Elena, and Sofia are members of the community bank â€œLos Sauces de CompaÃ±iaâ€. â€œLos Sauces do CompaÃ±ia" has 28 members, all of whom are from the area of CompaÃ±ia on the outskirts of the city. Herlinda, and Elena joined the bank one year ago, while Sofia has been a member for four years. Through the community bank they have found support and learned how to manage money.

Elena is 58 years old. She has three children, Herlinda is her oldest. Herlinda is 28 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children, one eight and the other five months. Sofia is 61 years old. She is a widow and has seven children.

All three women have small fields where they grow vegetables. In addition, they buy vegetables from other people in the area and sell them in the local market in the city of Ayacucho. Each of these women has been working in agriculture for her entire life.

They need loans of 600, 900, and 450 soles (2.8 soles = $1) respectively, which they will use to buy seeds and to transport their goods to the market.

Each woman has a savings account through the community bank and plans to use their savings to buy things such as a house, land, furniture, or pay for the education of their children. Their dream is to continue working and increase the amount of crops they can produce.

loan.use: They need loans of 600, 900, and 450 soles (2.8 soles = $1) respectively, which they will use to buy seeds and to transport their goods to the market.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Adzo

texts.en: Ms. Adzo K. is 33 years old and the married mother of 2 children, one boy and one girl, who are both enrolled in school. In order to provide for her family, Adzo buys and resells plastic containers such as trash cans, jugs and other such items which are widely used. Adzoâ€™s shop is located in the central market AdÃ©ta, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from LomÃ©, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Adzo would like to buy more plastic containers to increase the size of her business. The profits that this growth will bring will enable Adzo to continue to send her children to school and to provide for her family.

loan.use: To buy more plastic containers

loan.name: Adzo

texts.en: Ms. Adzo A. is a 34-year-old married woman with 2 children who are both enrolled in school. Adzo owns a shop located in the central market AdÃ©ta, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from LomÃ©, the capital of Togo. Here, Adzo sells many sizes and varieties of plates, pots and pans. She has been in this business for several years and would like to diversify her inventory to include kitchen utensils. With her loan, Adzo would like to buy silverware, ladles, large spoons and other kitchen utensils to increase the size of her business and attract more customers. The profits that this growth will bring will enable Adzo to continue to send her children to school and to provide for her family.

loan.use: To buy silverware, ladles, large spoons and other kitchen utensils

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo is 39 years old and originally from Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland. He is married and has 4 children: a 14-year-old girl, an 11-year-old boy, a 7-year-old boy and a 7-month-old girl. The 3 oldest are attending school.

Two years ago Paulo opened a small grocery stand near his house, where he sells food, drinks and basic needs. Beer is the most wanted item. His wife runs the stand from 7:00am to 7:00pm and they make around MTn 800 and MTn 1,000 per day.

The mother of Pauloâ€™s wife got sick a few months ago and stopped walking. Paulo and his family decided to move to a smaller house for MTn500 and rented out their house for MTn800.This helps them pay all the medical expenses. The grocery stand business also suffered in these last few months, as just a little money was available to buy inventory. Knowing Hluvuku since they opened their branch office in Namaacha in early 2007, Paulo decided to ask for a loan of MTn 7,000 to buy inventory and keep the grocery stand opened.

Paulo is hopeful that he will get a job as a bakery driver and will soon increase his income. In the future, Paulo would like to ask for another loan to keep improving the grocery stand, and eventually build his own carpentry to work with wood.

loan.use: Increase inventory

loan.name: Alejandro Anastasio

texts.es:
Mr. Alejandro Torres has been a farmer for two years, owning his own farm in the El Sauce area of LeÃ³n city in Nicaragua. He is a married father with responsibility of supporting his three children who need the unconditional support of their mother and father.

For quite a while he has been farming. Previously he worked on a farm that wasnâ€™t his but now he owns his own farm which he runs, raising cattle. Today this gentleman finds himself in need of buying calves to raise. Therefore he is seeking financial help from Ceprodel, who a few months ago supported him with loans to buy his cattle, thereby enabling him to support his family by working in agriculture and cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El seÃ±or Alejandro T. desde hace dos aÃ±os se dedica al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propio local en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de LeÃ³n en Nicaragua. Es padre casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos que necesitan del apoyo incondicional de su padre y madre.

Por mucho tiempo ha tenido experiencia en el trabajo de agricultura ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una finca que no era propia pero ahora que posee su propia finca la administra junto con el ganado que posee. Hoy en dÃ­a, la necesidad que este caballero atraviesa es la compra de vaquillas para la crianza de estas. Por este motivo busca financiamiento en Ceprodel quien desde hace varios meses le ha apoyado con prestamos para la compra de su ganado y asÃ­ continuar manteniendo a su familia por medio del trabajo de la agricultura y ganaderÃ­a .

loan.use: Purchase calves

loan.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
In the El Sauce area of LeÃ³n city, Mr. Alejandro M. has raised cattle since he was a youth, so he has a lot of experience in the business which has been the way he has supported his home. Today he is the father of six children who feel grateful to have a responsible and hardworking father

His wife has been a great help to Mr. M. by always supporting him in the business, and she has given him all her support in the home and by taking care of the children. In order to improve their quality of life Mr. M. needs to buy cattle, so he is seeking the support of Ceprodel for a loan that will enable him to move his business forward, enabling him to buy animals in order to later sell them. He has three previous loans with Ceprodel which have been paid according to the agreed upon terms.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de LeÃ³n, el seÃ±or Alejandro M. se dedica al negocio de la ganaderÃ­a desde su juventud teniendo una alta experiencia en este negocio que ha sido el sostÃ©n de su hogar desde que trabaja en ello. Hoy en dÃ­a es padre de seis hijos que se sienten muy agradecidos de tener un padre responsable y trabajador.

Su esposa ha sido una ayuda idÃ³nea para el seÃ±or M. por el hecho de que siempre le ha apoyado en el negocio y le ha brindado todo su apoyo en el hogar y cuido de los hijos. Para mejorar su condiciÃ³n de vida el seÃ±or M. requiere la compra de ganado por lo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crÃ©dito que le permita salir adelante y de esta manera comprar los animales para su respectiva comercializaciÃ³n. Hoy en dia su record crediticio es de 3 crÃ©ditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loan.use: Purchase cattle

loan.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban G. has had a farming business since he was young. He has his own land which he plants, cares for and harvests. To do so, he has a small shed at his house where he keeps the tools he needs for his field work, such as shovels, plows, reaper, and others.

Esteban has a family of 4 children and feels a duty to give them the education they deserve. In order to improve his economic condition he has requested a loan from CEPRODEL which will allow him to buy resources to protect and preserve the harvest. He currently has a record of 3 loans from CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El seÃ±or Esteban G. se dedica al negocio de agricultura desde su juventud teniendo sus propios terrenos los cuales los trabaja en la siembra, cuido, sanidad y siega del cultivo. Para ello cuenta con una pequeÃ±a bodega en su casa donde posee las herramientas necesarias para el trabajo en el campo destacÃ¡ndose entre ellas palas, maquinas de arado, pequeÃ±as maquinas de extracciÃ³n, y otros en general.

El seÃ±or Esteban es padre de familia y con la responsabilidad de 4 hijos que estÃ¡ en el deber de proporcionarle los estudios que estos se merecen. Para mejorar su condiciÃ³n econÃ³mica ha solicitado crÃ©dito en CEPRODEL que le permita la adquisiciÃ³n de recursos econÃ³micos para la compra de la cosecha, compra de preservantes y productos de cuido de dicha cosecha. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 3 crÃ©ditos con Ceprodel.

loan.use: Invest in his agricultural business.

loan.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe Martinez is married with 5 children. He works in agriculture, in the municipality of El Sauce where he has a small ranch. His ranch is located quite far from his house and he has to travel there by horse, which is the main means of transportation in this area.

Because he is a very responsible person, he has worked in this business for most of his life. It generates a small income for maintaining his home and his children. In order to improve this situation and provide a better standard of living to his family, Mr. Martinez has decided to request a loan from Ceprodel so that he can purchase some pregnant cows, from which he can get milk to sell and later on, sell the calves.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Felipe Martinez es un caballero casado y con 5 hijos a su deber. Se dedica en el municipio El Sauce al negocio de agropecuario teniendo su propia finca y por el hecho de estar ubicada muy alejado de su casa de habitaciÃ³n, debe de trasladarle hacia ella cabalgando un caballo que es su medio de transporte en esta localidad.

Por ser una persona muy responsable, ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a este negocio el cual le genera bajos ingreso para la mantenciÃ³n de su hogar y de sus hijos. Para mejorar esta situaciÃ³n y consiente de que debe de proporcionar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, el seÃ±or Martinez ha decidido solicitar crÃ©dito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de dar lugar a la compra de vacas en preÃ±ez para asÃ­ extraer de ellas la leche para su respectiva venta y luego comercializar sus productos derivados de este animal.

loan.use: Purchase cattle.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto R. is a hard-working man who is in agriculture. He has his own ranch in the municipality of El Sauce in LeÃ³n. He has worked at this business for a long time and acquired his abilities in ranching and farming when he was very young.

He is a married father with responsibilities for maintaining his four school-age children. He is known as being very responsible and hard-working, since every day very early in the morning he starts his job taking care of his fields while at the same time raising cattle in his own pen located at his house.

Ceprodel has been the backbone of his business because of having granted loans which have allowed him to improve his standard of living through the acquisition of cattle and vegetables for planting. Today, once again, he trusts that his credit will be approved and he will be able to improve his business with the purchase of cattle and vegetables to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Gilberto R. es un caballero muy esforzado que se dedica al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propia finca en el municipio El Sauce de LeÃ³n. Se dedica al negocio desde hace mucho tiempo habiendo adquirido habilidades con los animales y el cultivo desde muy jovencito en su localidad de habitaciÃ³n.

Es padre acompaÃ±ado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus cuatro hijos en edad escolar. Se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable y trabajadora puesto que todos los dÃ­as desde muy tempranas horas de la maÃ±ana inicia su trabajo de agricultura en la siembra y cuido de la cosecha y a la vez en la crianza de ganado en un corral propio en su casa de habitaciÃ³n.

Ceprodel ha sido una columna fuerte en su negocio debido a que le ha otorgado crÃ©ditos que le han permitido mejorar su condiciÃ³n de vida ya que ha adquirido el ganado y a la vez ha adquirido las hortalizas para la siembra. Hoy en dÃ­a una vez mas confÃ­a en que su crÃ©dito serÃ¡ aprobado y podrÃ¡ mejorar en su negocio con la compra del ganado y las hortalizas para la siembra.

loan.use: Purchase and raise cattle.

loan.name: JosÃ© RamÃ³n

texts.es:
Committed first and foremost to his family, and his business in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of LeÃ³n, JosÃ© RodrÃ­gues works very hard at ranching. His has his own herd of cattle with which he works day after day to earn a living to support his dear wife and two children.

As every business requires investment, the business at which Mr. RodrÃ­gues works needs to add some young bulls, which will be raised and sold. For this reason, once again he turns to Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will allow him to acquire the cattle and in this way, serve to help improve the standard of living of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

loan.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan R. is a native of the city of LeÃ³n in Nicaragua and he lives in the municipality of El Sauce. This is where he has his ranching business which allows him to support his family and provide for all the needs of his home.

Today Juan faces an urgent need to buy calves to raise. Because he does not have the economic means at this moment, he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel so he can purchase the cattle. He will be able to take full advantage of this purchase and commercialize them at the right time. He has had a total of 4 loans with CEPRODEL, all paid on time in accordance with their terms.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juan R. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de LeÃ³n en Nicaragua y habita en el municipio El Sauce que es donde posee su negocio ganadero con el que le permite dar mantenimiento a su familia supliendo todas las necesidades del hogar.

La necesidad que hoy en dÃ­a el seÃ±or Juan atraviesa es la urgencia de la compra de vaquillas para su debida crianza. Por este motivo es que al no poseer ingresos econÃ³micos en este momento, solicita crÃ©dito en Ceprodel para la compra de las vaquillas. Con esta compra tiene lugar para sacarles el mÃ¡ximo provecho y extraer en tiempo oportuno sus derivados para comercializarlos. Hoy en dÃ­a posee un total de 4 crÃ©ditos con CEPRODEL pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loan.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es:
Lester E. is a young father of three children who works in ranching, specifically raising cows for selling milk in his area of town. Together with his wife and children, they work hard to feed and care for the cows, taking care that they are maintained in a healthy state and do not ingest any food that could be harmful.

Once the milk is extracted, they begin the process of selling it, which they do either from their house or door-to-door in their municipality. In order to improve their business, they have approached CEPRODEL to obtain a loan which will allow them to buy calves and in this way get ahead and continue to support the family.

Translated fro Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Lester E. es un joven padre de tres hijos que se dedica al trabajo de la ganaderÃ­a especÃ­ficamente en la crianza de vaquillas para la extracciÃ³n de la leche para comercializarla en su sector de habitaciÃ³n. Junto con su esposa y sus hijos se esfuerza en el negocio alimentando al ganado y cuidÃ¡ndolo de que se mantenga puro y no vaya a ingerir algÃºn alimento en descomposiciÃ³n o en mal estado.

Al extraer la leche inicia el proceso de venta el cual lo realiza en su casa de habitaciÃ³n o ambulantemente en las calles de su municipio. Para mejorar la condiciÃ³n del negocio ha acudido a CEPRODEL para obtener crÃ©dito que le permita la compra de las vaquillas y de esta manera salir adelante y continuar manteniendo su nÃºcleo familiar.

loan.name: RamÃ³n Isidro

texts.es:
RamÃ³n T. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce, in the city of LeÃ³n. Ever since he was young, he has raised animals. This is the only business he has ever worked in. He has his own cattle, and little by little over time he has been improving and expanding the business with the goal of improving his familyÂ´s standard of living and continuing to pay for his childrensÂ´ education.

Ceprodel has been a fundamental part of Mr. T.Â´s ranching business for the fact of having provided loans which have been used to purchase calves and pregnant cows. Today, once again, RamÃ³n faces this need, but he trusts that his loan will be granted to that he can help his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

RamÃ³n T. es un caballero originario del municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de LeÃ³n. Se dedica desde su juventud a la crianza de animales siendo el Ãºnico negocio al que se dedica teniendo su propio ganado que poco a poco a travÃ©s del tiempo lo ha venido mejorando y ampliando con la visiÃ³n de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y continuar manteniendo los estudios de sus hijos.

Ceprodel ha sido un elemento fundamental en el negocio ganadero del seÃ±or T. por el hecho de que le ha brindado crÃ©ditos que han sido utilizados para la compra del Ganado como vaquillas y vacas en preÃ±es. loan.name: Ilusion Group

texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband on the Eastern peninsula of Samana, DR. She has raised three children (ages: 24, 25, 26) and now focuses on her small business. She sells new clothing from a small store, and with the money from this loan she wants to buy a fresh supply of clothes to add to her store. In her free time she enjoys reading, and her favorite food is fish. She hopes that in the future she will see the Dominican economy get stronger and stronger.

This will be the 4th loan that â€œIlusionâ€ has applied for with Esperanza, and they all appreciate the support of Kiva lenders that has maD. this possible. On behalf of Esperanza, thank you for investing in the lives of these borrowers. The impact will be sustained far into the future!

loan.use: To buy new clothes to add to her current merchandise.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Invest in a greater variety of merchandise

loan.name: Ayaba

texts.en: Ms. Ayaba K. is 43 years old and the married mother of 1 child who is enrolled in school. To provide for her family Ayaba sells â€˜sandelettes,â€™ or flip-flops, and plastic containers in a small boutique located in the central market of AdÃ©ta. These comfortable and inexpensive shoes and reliable, useful containers are very popular among the Togolese and are always in demand. Ayaba is requesting this loan for two reasons: first, she would like to build a display for her merchandise to attract more customers and second, she hopes to buy more flip-flops and containers to increase the size of her business. She hopes that by increasing her commercial activity she can respond to the needs of her family and can continue to participate in the development of her community.

loan.use: To build a display for her merchandise (flip flops and plastic containers) and to increase her inventory

loan.name: Afi

texts.en: Afi A. is 50 years old and the married mother of a 26-year-old daughter. Her daughter helps her in their boutique, which is located in the central market of AdÃ©ta. Popular dress in Togo consists of a skirt and top cut and tailored from a length of fabric, and another length of fabric wrapped around the waist. These pieces of fabric, which are vibrantly colored and lightweight, are called pagnes. Selling pagnes is a popular business for women in Afiâ€™s region, as they travel to LomÃ©, the capital, to purchase them to resell in the market in AdÃ©ta. With her loan Afi hopes to send her daughter to LomÃ© to buy more pagnes in various prints and colors to increase her stock. She also hopes that this trip will teach her daughter more about the business. With the revenue generated from this expansion, Afi will be able to continue to provide for her daughter and her husband.

loan.use: To buy more pagnes (West African fabrics)

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Ami

texts.en: Ms. Ami K. is a young woman of 22 years who is recently married and does not yet have children. She owns a small boutique in the central market of AdÃ©ta, a small village located about 150 kilometers from LomÃ©, the capital of Togo. She buys and resells plastic containers such as trash cans, jugs and other such items which are widely used here for a variety of purposes. With this loan, Ami would like to diversify and grow her new business to increase the quality of life for herself and her husband.

loan.use: To diversify and expand her business by buying more plastic containers

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Confort

texts.en: Ms. Confort A. is a friendly woman of 44 who lives and works in AdÃ©ta, Togo, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from the capital, LomÃ©. Confort is married and the mother of 4 children who all go to school nearby. To pay for her childrensâ€™ education, Confort sells refreshing drinks and snacks in the central market in AdÃ©ta. She has strategically placed her stand at the entrance to the market, to catch thirsty shoppers on their way in and out. Confort specializes in Akpan GlacÃ©, a traditional refreshing snack of soaked maize, which becomes soft and puffy, mixed with ice and sugar. She also sells Citron GlacÃ©, iced lemonade, which helps to quench shoppersâ€™ thirsts on a hot Togolese afternoon. Confort hopes to use her loan to buy more maize, sugar, ice, and lemons so that she can continue to run her refreshment stand, which allows her to provide for her family.

loan.use: To buy maize, sugar, ice, and lemons

loan.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaovi K. is 46 years old, married and the father of two children in school. He lives and works in the town of Adeta, about 20 miles from KpalimÃ©. He manages a pharmacy next to the town hospital and also a store that sells mosquito nets. He mainly sells anti-malaria drugs, contraceptives and medication for upset stomachs. He wants to use this loan to increase his stock of medicines in order to satisfy the ever-increasing demand of the local population. The profits from his business enable him to provide for his family and pay for the schooling of his two children.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.name: SeÃ±or De Exaltacion Group

texts.es:
In the Villa Tejada Zone lies a Focus Center with the same name, to which the SeÃ±or de Exaltacion Association and its 16 members belong to. This is a very pleasant and likeable group, being that aside from working together with the loan system that Pro-Mujer offers them, they all formed a very beautiful friendship.

There are several activities that the women of the association perform. One of them owns a store that sells provisions while others sell prepared meals, ice cream or potatoes, but the majority of them make clothing such as blouses, pants, dresses and other garments. These items are created by them.

They now need more capital to purchase imported fabrics and special equipment to expand their businesses and be able to offer their higher quality products outside of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En la zona de villa tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociaciÃ³n â€œseÃ±or de exaltacionâ€que cuenta con 16 socias. Un grupo muy simpÃ¡tico ya que ademÃ¡s de trabajar juntas con el sistema de crÃ©ditos que Pro-Mujer les ofrece, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas. Son varias las actividades que realiza la asociaciÃ³n â€œ, alguna de ellas tiene una tienda de vÃ­veres, otras socias venden comida, helados, papas, pero la mayorÃ­a se dedica a la confecciÃ³n de ropa como ser: blusas, pantalones y vestidos y otros. loan.name: Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Twelve women form the Tres Estrellas Association and have worked with Pro-Mujer for approximately 4 years. They are a very joyful group, and they are happy with the benefits that this center offers them. Eight of them are married and on average have about 4 children each, with the majority being less than 10 years of age. They each perform different activities such as selling prepared meals, running a cafÃ© and making products woven with alpaca and offer them in the different markets of the city of La Paz. They would like to request bigger loans to inject capital into their businesses to obtain greater earnings for the well-being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

12 mujeres conforman la asociaciÃ³n â€œTres Estrellasâ€ que trabajan con Pro-Mujer hace 4 aÃ±os aproximadamente, un grupo muy alegre y contento con los beneficios que el centro les brinda. 8 de ellas son casadas y tienen un promedio de cuatro hijos, en su mayorÃ­a menores a 10 aÃ±os. Se dedican a diferentes actividades, como ser la venta de comida, cafeterÃ­a, tejidos en alpaca productos que los ofrecen en los distintos mercado de la ciudad de La Paz. Ellas quieren tener mayores crÃ©ditos para inyectar de capital a sus negocios de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias para el bien de sus niÃ±os

loan.name: Antofagasta Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto lies the Villa Tejada Focus Center, to which the Antofagasta Association has been a part of for over 4 years and consists of 16 women anxious to prosper in their small businesses.

The majority of the groupâ€™s members are married and say they need to help their husbands with their householdâ€™s finances since each have an average of 4 children. Such is the case of Eugenia, who regretfully widowed and had to care for her family on her own and now needs greater earnings to persevere.

The chief activity in the group is sales. They sell chompas (ponchos) woven in wool, prepared meals, natural fruit juices, cosmetics and other items depending on the season, which they sell in the fair of the Tiahuanacu market in the city of El Alto. They need capital to increase their merchandise stock, and in that way generate greater income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de Villa Tejada a Ã©ste pertenece, hace mas de 4 aÃ±os la asociaciÃ³n â€œAntofagastaâ€, integradas por 16 mujeres ansiosas de progresar en sus pequeÃ±os negocios.

La mayorÃ­a en el grupo son casadas y afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus esposos en la economÃ­a del hogar, ya que tienen un promedio de 4 niÃ±os cada una, tal es el caso de doÃ±a Eugenia que lamentablemente quedo viuda y tubo que hacerse cargo de su familia ella sola por lo que necesita mayores recursos para. subsistir.

loan.name: Obreras Group

texts.es:
The Obreras Association has been part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than 5 years and has completed 8 loan cycles. It is situated in the Villa Tejada zone in the city of El Alto. To date, it has 18 members who have demonstrated to be an organized group in regard to the centerâ€™s work.

A large majority of them do not own a home, which leads them to pay monthly leases for small living areas that are not big enough for their numerous families. They face the necessity of saving money with the dream of owning their own home.

Crafts are the main activity of this group, producing furniture, shoes, ceramics, paints and other items. They need more capital to expand their workshops and buy larger amounts of prime material, and in this way increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociaciÃ³n denominada â€œObrerasâ€ pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace ya cinco aÃ±os cumpliendo con 8 ciclos de crÃ©dito, esta se encuentra en la zona de Villa Tejada, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 18 socias que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto al trabajo del centro.

La artesanÃ­a es la actividad principal de este grupo, produciendo asÃ­, muebles, zapatos, cerÃ¡micas. pinturas, y otros. Necesitan de mayor capital para ampliar sus talleres y comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima de esta manera sus ganancias serian mayores.

loan.use: Obtain capital to expand their workshops and purchase larger amounts of prime material.

loan.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is very creative and her artistic sensitivity is expressed in the beautiful embroidery that she develops every day with her wonderful hands in the comfort of her own home, because she also wants to take care of her 4 children. Her beautiful handiwork has resulted in the increased popularity of her work in a short period of time. She plans in the near future to make embroidery at a company level with the growth of her small shop. For some time she has been working with this goal in mind and is asking for a loan through this venue to acquire a larger quantity of cloth and embroidery yarn so that she does not have to interrupt her daily tasks.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Adela es muy creativa y su sensibilidad artÃ­stica se plasma en los bellos bordados que cada dÃ­a desarrolla con sus manos maravillosas en la comodidad de su hogar porque desea tambiÃ©n estar al pendiente de sus 4 hijos. Sus bellos acabados han hecho que en poco tiempo se popularice sus servicios, tiene en mente dentro de poco dedicarse a la elaboraciÃ³n de bordados a nivel empresarial con la consolidaciÃ³n de su pequeÃ±o taller y precisamente con el propÃ³sito de alcanzar este objetivo viene trabajando desde hace mucho y en a travÃ©s de este portal solicita un prÃ©stamo de dinero a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de hilos y telas para no interrumpir su tarea diaria.

texts.es:
After having spent many years of her life working as a street vendor, Marilu has recently established a small business selling general consumer products in a space in her home. The urgent needs of her developing children and her husbandâ€™s departure have injected her with much strength and fortitude to continue with her work. She wishes to increase the quantity of her products and make her store more popular, that is the reason for her request of a loan to grow her small space where she works every day.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

DespuÃ©s de haber dedicado muchos aÃ±os de su vida al comercio ambulatorio, MarilÃº se acaba de establecer con su pequeÃ±o negocio de venta de artÃ­culos de primera necesidad en un espacio de su hogar. La necesidad apremiante de sus hijos en pleno desarrollo y el abandono de su esposo le han inyectado mucha fuerza y entereza para continuar con su labor.Desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos y popularizar los servicios de su tienda, por ese motivo solicita un prÃ©stamo para consolidar su pequeÃ±o espacio de labor diaria.

loan.name: MarÃ­a

DoÃ±a Maria is a sewing expert. Her abilities to combine wool fibers and produce beautiful garments make her products of excellent quality. She makes tablecloths, hats, and wool scarves, as well as crochet work. Her ability and curiosity have innovated models and produced exclusive designs. As part of her desire to better herself and improve, DoÃ±a Maria has received trainings about business ideas and exporting. She wants to obtain a loan to increase her capital and invest it in buying a bigger quantity of raw material to continue to make her beautiful garments.

loan.name: Zarita

Zarita possesses a lot of talent in making wool garments with knitting needles. She has the noble wish of forming a group of knitters with the goal of networking and making garments on a bigger scale and of a bigger variety. With this purpose in mind, she asks for your support to begin her road towards progress.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. DoÃ±a Lelia, in conjunction with her older children, has installed an auto body in her home to lend her services to the hundreds of motorists in the city. loan.name: Rosa

Rosa has begun her work as a guina pig raiser as an experiment and with the desire of increasing the economic income of her beloved family. She has installed a breeding space similar to those that other families in the city established and has begun her work with a small number of guinea pigs. Those, in a small amount of time, due to excellent food and care, have reproduced very quickly and now have doubled in number. She has a desire to increase the space in order to proviD. them with more freedom and comfort so that they reach the weight and size desired by her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Rosa, ha iniciado su labor D. criadora D. cuyes D. modo experimental y por la iniciativa y deseos D. incrementar los ingresos econÃ³micos D. su amada familia. Ha instalado un espacio D. crianza a semejanza D. las que establecieron otras familias D. su ciudad y ha iniciado su tarea con un nÃºmero pequeÃ±o D. ejemplares. En poco tiempo estos debido a la excelente alimentaciÃ³n y cuidados se han reproducido muy rÃ¡pido y ahora han duplicado su nÃºmero, tiene deseos D. ampliar su espacio a fin D. otorgarles mayor libertad y comodidad para que alcancen el peso y tamaÃ±o deseado por sus clientes.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Juana's Group

texts.en:
Karina, Ana, and Juana are members of the community bank â€œLos Sauces de CompaÃ±iaâ€. â€œLos Sauces do CompaÃ±ia has 28 members, all of whom are from the area of CompaÃ±ia on the outskirts of the city. They joined the bank one and a half years ago and have now completed three loan cycles. Through the community bank they have learned how to manage money and be responsible.

All three women live with their partners. Karina is twenty and has a two-year-old son. Ana is 26 and has a four-year-old daughter and two year old son. Juana is 28 and has two sons who are eight and six.

Karina, Ana, and Juana are members of brick-0making families. For several generations their families have made and fired adobe bricks. However, all of them hope that their children will leave the trade. Their dreams are that their children will receive good educations and find work as professionals.

They need loans of 300, 1200, and 450 soles (2.8 soles = $1) respectively. They will invest their loans by purchasing things such as fore wood, charcoal, and paying employees.

loan.use: Purchase materials for making bricks

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Rosario's Group

texts.es:
Miriam, Mery y Rosario have belonged to the 30 de junio Banco Comunal for 6 years, 8 months and 2 years.

Miriam is married, is 30 years old and has 3 children. She sells meat house-to-house in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells blankets at different fairs throughout the region.

Mery lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has 2 children. She sells breakfast walking through the Nery GarcÃ­a market. Mery used to sell potatoes but stopped doing so because her son is young.

Rosario is separated, is 40 years old and has three children. She sells emoliente (a hot drink with healing properties) walking through the Nery GarcÃ­a market.

Miriam, Mery and Rosario need loans of 600, 1000 and 300 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of meat, blankets, sugars, herbs and, in Mery's case, to pay for part of the land that she is going to buy.

Miriam, Mery and Rosario's dreams to have money in the future, their own homes and improves their businesses and for their children to become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Miriam, Mery y Rosario pertenecen al Banco Comunal 30 de junio hace 6 aÃ±os, 8 meses, 2 aÃ±os.

Miriam es casada, tiene 30 aÃ±os y 3 hijos, Miriam vende carne de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho. AdemÃ¡s Miriam vende mantas en las diferentes ferias de la regiÃ³n.

Por otro lado Mery es conviviente, tiene 30 aÃ±os y 2 hijos, Mery vende desayuno en el mercado Nery GarcÃ­a de manera ambulatoria. Anteriormente Mery vendÃ­a tubÃ©rculos actividad que dejo de realizar porque su hijo es pequeÃ±o.

Mientras que Rosario es separada, tiene 40 aÃ±os y 3 hijos, Rosario vende emoliente (bebida caliente con propiedades curativas) de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery GarcÃ­a.

Miriam, Mery y Rosario necesitan prÃ©stamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, 300 soles, dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de carne, mantas, azÃºcar, hierbas y en el caso de Mery es para pagar una parte del terreno que comprarÃ¡.

Los sueÃ±os de Miriam, Mery y Rosario son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener dinero en el futuro, casa propia y mejorar sus negocios.

loan.use: Miriam, Mery y Rosario need loans of 600, 1000 and 300 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of meat, blankets, sugar, herbs and, in Mery's case to pay for part of the land that she is going to buy.

loan.name: Benita's Group

texts.es:
Benita, Marcelina y Celestina have belonged to the Yanapanakusun Banco Comunal, which means "let's help ourselves" in quechua, for 10, 1 and 12 years respectively.

Benita is separated, is 41 years old and has 4 children. She sells food in a rented stall on the puente nuevo. Benita also has a small grocery store in her house that is run by her daughter.

Marcelina lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 3 children. She sells candy, cakes and chicha (corn whiskey) while walking along the Avenida Javier PÃ©rez.

Celestina is married, is 57 years old and has 6 children. Celestina and her husband have a carpentry shop in their house.

Benita, Marcelina y Celestina need loans of 600, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soap, detergent, oil, cookies, soft drinks and wood.

Benita, Marcelina and Celestina's dreams are to improve their businesses, for their children to become working professionals, and to have stable business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Benita, Marcelina y Celestina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa â€œAyudÃ©monosâ€ en quechua, hace 10, 1, 12 aÃ±os respectivamente.

Benita es separada, tiene 41 aÃ±os y 4 hijos, Benita venD. comida en un local alquilado en el puente nuevo. AdemÃ¡s Benita tiene una pequeÃ±a tienda D. abarrotes en su casa que esta administrado por su hija.

Por otro lado Marcelina es conviviente, tiene 28 aÃ±os y 3 hijos, Marcelina venD. golosinas, pasteles y chicha D. manera ambulatoria en la Av. Javier PÃ©rez.

Mientras que Celestina es casada, tiene 57 aÃ±os y 6 hijos, Celestina junto a su esposo tienen un taller D. carpinterÃ­a en su casa.

Benita, Marcelina y Celestina necesitan un prÃ©stamo D. 600 soles, 450 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra D. arroz, azÃºcar, jabÃ³n, detergente, aceite, galletas, gaseosas y maderas.

Los sueÃ±os D. Benita, Marcelina y Celestina son mejorar sus negocios, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un negocio estable.

loan.use: Benita, Marcelina y Celestina need loans of 600, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soap, detergent, oil, cookies, soft drinks and wood.

loan.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
Nemecia works all day, every day, in a small space outside her home which she established with the goal of selling vegetables in the morning and sandwiches in the evening. With the income that she receives daily from her work, she can fully maintain her beloved children. She wishes to increase her capital in order to make a greater quantity of meals and to make her facilities more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Nemecia, labora todo el dÃ­a y todos los dÃ­as en un pequeÃ±o espacio fuera de su hogar que estableciÃ³ con el propÃ³sito de comercializar vegetales por las maÃ±anas y diversos bocadillos por las tardes. Con el ingreso que percibe a diario por su labor puede mantener plenamente a sus queridos hijos.Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para elaborar mayor cantidad de alimentos y para hacer mÃ¡s cÃ³moda sus instalaciones de servicio.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Leoncia's Group

texts.es:
Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen have belonged to the Yanapanakusun Banco Comunal, which means "Let's help ourselves" in quechua, for 3, 5, and 3 years respectively.

Benjamina is a single mother, is 55 years old and has one daughter. She makes desserts and mazamorra (cornmeal porridge) and sells them in her daughter's restaurant.

Leoncia lives with her partner, is 45 years old and has 4 daughters. She sells children's clothing, backpacks and sombreros and depending on the location she sells in different fairs in the region and sometimes in some locations in the city.

Carmen lives with her partner, is 42 years old and has 3 children. She has a small business organizing events. She provides services such as decoration, the preparation of food, cakes and other services.

Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen need loans of 450, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of milk, sugar, and eggs for making cakes, and backpacks, fabric and acrylics.

Benjamina, Leoncia and Carmen's dreams are for their family to be healthy and understanding, for their children to become professionals, to have their own home and for their stores to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa â€œAyudÃ©monosâ€ en quechua, hace 3, 5, 3 aÃ±os respectivamente.

Benjamina es madre soltera, tiene 55 aÃ±os y 1 hija, Benjamina hace postres, mazamorras y lo vende en el restaurante de su hija.

Por otro lado Leoncia es conviviente, tiene 45 aÃ±os y 4 hijas, Leoncia vende ropa de niÃ±os, mochilas, sombreros dependiendo de la campaÃ±a, sus ventas lo realiza en las diferentes ferias de la regiÃ³n y algunas veces alquila puestos en la ciudad.

Mientras que Carmen es conviviente, tiene 42 aÃ±os y 3 hijos, Carmen tiene una pequeÃ±a empresa organizadora de eventos que brinda servicios de decoraciÃ³n de locales, elaboraciÃ³n de comida, tortas, entre otros servicios.

Los sueÃ±os de Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen son que su familia tengan buena salud y comprensiÃ³n, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia y una tienda bien implementada.

loan.use: Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen need loans of 450, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of milk, sugar, and eggs for making cakes, and backpacks, fabric and acrylics.

loan.name: Susi

texts.es:
Susi is a hard-working woman. Thanks to her efforts and dedication her beloved family has been able to overcome painful moments of financial scarcity through her sales of cosmetics. Her performance over three years has been notable and she has a wide range of clients and friends who month over month request her products. She has in mind the goal to set up shop in a commercial center from which she may offer her beauty services and products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Susi, es una mujer muy trabajadora, gracias a su empeÃ±o y dedicaciÃ³n su amada familia ha podido superar penosos momentos de escasez econÃ³mica, con la venta de cosmÃ©ticos.Su desempeÃ±o durante tres aÃ±os ha sido notable y cuenta con una gran gama de clientes y amistades que mes a mes solicitan sus productos, tiene en mente instalarse en un centro comercial para desde este lugar brindar sus servicios de asesoramiento y venta de productos de belleza.

loan.use: More capital in order to offer a greater quantity of products so that she may establish herself in a space in the busier commercial center of her city.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Juana Carmen's Group

texts.es:
Briggett, Rosa y Juana have belonged to the Banco Comunal of Yanapanakusun, which means "let's help ourselves" in quechua, for 1, 1 and 4 years respectively.

Briggett is a single mother, is 20 years old and have one son who is a systems engineering student. Briggett has a store where she sells clothing, groceries, and toys. She buys some of her products in the city of Lima.

Rosa lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Rosa and her husband make corn canchas (toasted snacks made from grains) , wheat, and noodles, which they sell wholesale out of their house.

Juana is married, is 53 years old and has 2 children. Juana sells underwear to friends and acquaintances. She also works in a social aid institution.

Briggett, Rosa y Juana need loans of 1000, 600 and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of shirts, pants, shoes, noodles, corn, wheat and underwear.

Briggett, Rosa and Juana's dreams are to have a store in the city center, to travel abroad, to provide their children with a good education and to have a house in the city of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Briggett, Rosa y Juana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa â€œAyudÃ©monosâ€ en quechua, hace 1 aÃ±o, 4 meses, 1 aÃ±o respectivamente.

Briggett es madre soltera, tiene 20 aÃ±os y 1 hijo, estudiante de IngenierÃ­a de Sistemas, Briggett tiene una bodega donde vende ropa, abarrotes, juguetes, algunos de sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Por otro lado Rosa es conviviente, tiene 33 aÃ±os y 2 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo elabora canchas (bocaditos hechos de cereales que son tostados) de maÃ­z, trigo, fideo y sus ventas lo realizan en su casa al por mayor.

Mientras que Juana es casada, tiene 53 aÃ±os y 2 hijos, Juana vende ropas interiores, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. AdemÃ¡s trabaja en una instituciÃ³n como asistenta social.

Briggett, Rosa y Juana necesitan prÃ©stamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones, zapatos, fideo, maÃ­z, trigo y ropas interiores.

Los sueÃ±os de Briggett, Rosa y Juana son tener su tienda en el centro de la ciudad, viajar al extranjero, brindarles una buena educaciÃ³n a sus hijos y tener una casa en la ciudad de Lima.

loan.use: Briggett, Rosa y Juana need loans of 1000, 600 and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of shirts, pants, shoes, noodles, corn, wheat and underwear.

loan.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is a woman who is very committed to the development of her home. On a daily basis, she dedicates herself to providing service from her shop in addition to working as the municipal councilor of her community. Her knowledge and good management have been the contributing factors to her becoming a female leader in her community. She works with her family in the countrysiD. and also tends to her cows in her stable. She wishes to proviD. better service in her store and acquire a greater quantity of products for the benefit of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Bertha, es una mujer muy comprometida con el desarrollo D. su espacio habitacional y familiar, se dedica a diario a brindar servicios en su tienda y tambiÃ©n a desempeÃ±ar el cargo D. regidora en su comunidad. Sus conocimientos y buena administraciÃ³n han sido factores preponderantes para convertirse en una mujer lÃ­der D. su localidad.Trabaja con su familia en el campo y tambiÃ©n atienD. a sus vaquitas en su establo. Desea brindar un mejor servicio en su bodega y adquirir mayor cantidad D. productos para beneficio D. sus clientes.

loan.use: Incremental capital to acquire a greater quantity of raw materials.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a hard-working mother dedicated to her family. She works alongside her husband on farmland sowing corn, potatoes, and barley in order to support her beloved children. She has the aim of working more enthusiastically at harvest time and, with the next planting, gradually improve her familyâ€™s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es una madre muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Se desempeÃ±a en compaÃ±Ã­a de su esposo en sus tierras agrÃ­colas sembrando maÃ­z, papa y cebada para el sostÃ©n de sus queridos hijos.Tiene el propÃ³sito de laborar con mayor ahÃ­nco en la cosecha y prÃ³xima siembra con el objetivo de mejorar paulatinamente la calidad de vida de su familia.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Victoria's Group

texts.es:
Yolanda, Nely and Victoria are members of the Kutimuy Community Bank, which means "Come Back" in Quechua.

Yolanda is 28 years old and has 4 children. With her husband, she bakes bread. Her sales are maD. in fair and are also sold in bulk at kiosks.

Nely is married. She is 32 years old and has 2 children. Nely and her husband are artisans who make rugs and belts, which they sell at the market in Santa Clara. Nely also travels to fairs once a month, where she purchases cheese which she then sells door to door.

Victoria is married. She is 63 years old and has 6 children. Victoria makes cloth products like small blankets, which she sells at the market in Santa Clara.

Yolanda, Nely and Victoria need loans of 400 soles each, money which will be invested in the purchase of flour, sesame, wool, thread and dye.

Yolanda, Nely and Victoria dream of improving their businesses, having their children become professionals and having a factory of cloth products with many employees.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda, Nely y Victoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa â€œRegresaâ€ en quechua.

Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 28 aÃ±os y 4 hijos, Yolanda junto a su esposo panifican panes en un horno alquilado, sus ventas lo realizan en ferias y tambiÃ©n reparten a kioscos por mayor.

Por otro lado Nely es casada, tiene 32 aÃ±os y 2 hijos, Nely junto a su esposo realizan artesanÃ­a en telar como tapices, cinturones que venden en el mercado Santa Clara. AdemÃ¡s Nely viaja a las ferias una vez por mes donD. compra quesos y lo venD. D. casa en casa.

Mientras que Victoria es casada, tiene 63 aÃ±os y 6 hijos, Victoria realiza trabajos en telar como frazadas y lo venD. en el mercado Santa Clara.

loan.use: Purchasing flour, sesame, wool, thread and dye

loan.name: Cupertino

texts.es:
Don Cupertino is a hard-working and loving father. Since his wife decided to leave him along with his two dear children, he has worked hard to provide them the basics so that they can develop fully. In a small shop in his home, he makes spoons and ladles of wood and then, when he finishes his weekly work, he goes to the markets in his city in order to sell his products at reasonable prices. He gets a great reception and, thanks to the income that he generates, his work covers the education expenses of his beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Don Cupertino es un padre muy trabajador y amoroso, desde que su esposa decidiÃ³ abandonarlo junto a sus dos queridos hijos se ha esforzado para brindarles lo necesario a fin de que estos puedan desarrollarse plenamente. En un pequeÃ±o taller de su hogar elabora cucharas y cucharones de madera y luego de concluir su labor semanal se desplaza a las ferias de su ciudad para ofertar sus productos a precios muy mÃ³dicos, tiene gran acogida y gracias a las ganacias que le genera su labor satisface los gastos de educaciÃ³n de sus queridos hijos.

loan.use: More capital to acquire new tools and a greater quantity of raw materials.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Perseverance and diligent work helps Edilberto to excel and be one of the best livestock farmers in his area. Every day, he is focused on the development and feeding of his beloved cattle. In the mornings, with much delicacy, he milks the cows. His wife in is charge of distributing the milk to his customers who make cheeses and pastries in their community. He also offers meat and sometimes sells in the livestock markets in his city. He has a great desire to increase the number of animals in his stable and improve the conditions of his livestock supply in order to obtain exceptional development.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La perseverancia y trabajo diligente ayudan a Edilberto a sobresalir y a ser uno de los mejores ganaderos de su zona. Todos los dÃ­as estÃ¡ pendiente del desarrollo de sus queridas vaquitas y de su alimentaciÃ³n, con mucha delicadeza por las maÃ±anas saca la leche que su querida esposa se encarga de repartir a sus clientes para la elaboraciÃ³n de quesos y postres dentro de su comunidad; tambiÃ©n oferta su carne y en algunas oportunidades las vende en las ferias ganaderas de su ciudad.Tiene mucho deseo de incrementar el nÃºmero de los animalitos en su establo y mejorar las condiciones de su alimentaciÃ³n a fin de que obtengan un desarrollo excepcional.

loan.use: Capital to improve the conditions of his livestock supply and increase their number.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Viviana's Group

texts.es:
Gloria, Justina and Vivana have been partners of the Kutimuy Community Bank, which means "Come Back" in Quechua, for 12, 3 and 10 years respectively.

Gloria is 32 years old and has 3 children. She is an artisan who creates beautiful products on the loom, an activity that she does along with her husband and children. She also has a small general store in her home.

Justina is married. She is 38 years old and has 3 children. Justina and her family create cloth products like bags that are sold in a factory where Justina works as an embroiderer.

Viviana is a single mother. She is 42 years old and has 1 child. She travels to fairs in the region where she sells vegetables and fish. Vivana also sells small animals in the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Gloria, Justina and Viviana need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles and 600 soles respective, money that will be invested in the purchasing of thread, dye, straw hats and fish.

Gloria, Justina and Viviana dream of having their own homes and businesses. They also want to provide their children with a good education and provide their products to the provinces.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria, Justina y Viviana son socias del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa â€œRegresaâ€ en quechua hace 12, 3, 10 aÃ±os respectivamente.

Gloria es conviviente, tiene 32 aÃ±os y 3 hijos, Gloria es artesana, realiza bellos trabajos en telar como individuales, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo e hijos. AdemÃ¡s Gloria tiene una pequeÃ±a tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Justina es casada, tiene 38 aÃ±os y 3 hijos, Justina junto a su familia realizan trabajos en telar como bolsos que son vendidos a una empresa donde Justina trabaja bordando.

Mientras que Viviana es madre soltera, tiene 42 aÃ±os y 1 hijo, Viviana viaja a las ferias de la regiÃ³n donde vende verduras y pescado. AdemÃ¡s Viviana se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Gloria, Justina y Viviana necesitan prÃ©stamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de hilos, tintes, pavitas y pescado.

Los sueÃ±os de Gloria, Justina y Viviana son tener casa propia, un negocio propio, sus hijos tengan una buena educaciÃ³n y proveer directamente sus productos a provincias.

loan.use: Purchasing of thread, dye, and fish

loan.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy is a hard-working and dedicated woman. Her wishes to offer exclusive knitwear and to dress the beautiful mothers of her city well led her to establish a small shop for selling clothing and footwear where she personally accessorizes each person who visits her each day. Thanks to her efforts and good taste her gains and wishes have not been made to wait. She now plans to expand and start a chain of stores with the name that gained popularity in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Lucy, es una mujer muy laboriosa y dedicada, sus deseos por ofrecer prendas exclusivas y vestir bien a las bellas madres de familia de su ciudad la condujeron a instalar un pequeÃ±o espacio de ventas de prendas de vestir y calzado en el que asesora personalmente a cada una de las personas que la visitan a diario.Gracias a su desempeÃ±o y buen gusto las ganacias y deseos de mejorar no se han hecho esperar y ahora tiene planeado expandirse y constituir una cadena de tiendas con el nombre que le dio popularidad dentro de su comunidad.

loan.use: Capital to start her entrepreneurial dream.

loan.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is an excellent teacher of traditional dance and a loving mother; with the help of her husband she works not only to share her knowledge of dance with young students of the city, but also in selling a variety of household articles in various markets. These jobs have helped her to ensure the well-being of her children, but in her heart is the hope of creating a small school of traditional dance to pass on the artistic legacy of her ancestors to the youth of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

Consuelo es una excelente maestra de danzas tÃ­picas y un amorosa madre; con ayuda de su querido esposo se dedica ademÃ¡s de impartir sus conocimientos a los jÃ³venes estudiantes de su ciudad a ofertar los dÃ­as de feria diversos artÃ­culos de uso domÃ©stico en los diferentes lugares de concentraciÃ³n popular.Estas actividades le han otorgado bienestar a sus queridas pequeÃ±as, pero acogen en sus corazones el deseo de instalar en casa una pequeÃ±a escuela de danzas tÃ­picas para interiorizaciÃ³n del legado artÃ­stico de sus antepasados a las generaciones jÃ³venes de su ciudad.

loan.use: Capital to install a school of traditional dance in her home.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Maria Cristina's Group

texts.es:
Maribel, Cristina, and Dina have belonged to the Communal Bank â€œPalomaâ€ for 1 year, 8 months, and 8 months, respectively.

Maribel has a live-in partner, she is 24 years old and has one daughter. Maribel sells clothes on credit to family and friends. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. She also sells food on some occasions.

Cristina is single and is 24 years old. She has a store where she sells meat, groceries, and vegetables. On some occasions she sells cosmetics through a catalog.

Dina also has a live-in partner, she is 37 years old and has 3 children. She sells food in a bus terminal. With the loan that she will obtain, Dina will buy a refrigerator.

Maribel, Cristina and Dina need loans of 600 soles ($230 US), 800 soles ($300 US), and 1000 soles ($370 US), money that will be invested in the purchase of jerseys, jackets, rice, sugar, milk, eggs, plates, spoons, and for the down payment on a refrigerator.

The dreams of Maribel, Cristina and Dina are to have stable businesses, to finish their higher education, and to open additional branches and other businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kaleigh Ruffner, Breanna Wong and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

Maribel, Cristina y Dina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Paloma hace 1 aÃ±o, 8 meses, 8 meses respectivamente.

Maribel es conviviente, tiene 24 aÃ±os y 1 hija, Maribel vende ropa a crÃ©dito a familiares y amigos, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima. AdemÃ¡s Maribel en algunas ocasiones vende comida.

Por otro lado Cristina es soltera y tiene 24 aÃ±os, Cristina tiene una bodega donde vende carne, abarrotes, verduras. En algunas ocasiones Cristina vende cosmÃ©ticos por catÃ¡logo.

Mientras que Dina es conviviente, tiene 37 aÃ±os y 3 hijos, Dina vende comida en un puesto del terminal terrestre. Dina con el prÃ©stamo que obtendrÃ¡ comprarÃ¡ su refrigeradora.

Maribel, Cristina y Dina necesitan prÃ©stamos de 600 soles, 800 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de polos, casacas, arroz, azÃºcar, leche, huevo, platos, cucharas y para la inicial de una refrigeradora.

loan.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina has been selling brand-name cosmetics which are popular in her country for a long time now. She has decided to take up this work after observing the economic struggle of her family during periods of absence of her husband, who makes a living as a musician, touring throughout the country with his band. Her involvement in this business has been very positive, and her knowledge of beauty products has increased. Now Georgina is hoping for a loan of $300 to increase her investment capital in order to offer a greater quantity of products, and also offer cosmetic advice out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

loan.name: Diudora

texts.es:
Diudora has been a member of the Communal Bank â€œLegionâ€ for the past 8 years.

She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Diudora has a replacement auto-parts store on Arenales Avenue, and her husband owns a repair shop for cars.

In addition, Diudora has a transportation business that runs from the communities of the District of Acosvinchos, and she has three cars that run this route. Diudora plans to develop an interprovincial transportation business.

Diudora needs a loan of 3000 soles (approx. $1125 US) which she will invest in the purchase of headlights, starters, and alternators that will be brought from the city of Lima.

Diudoraâ€™s dreams are for her children to become professionals, to have a larger store, to have an interprovincial transportation business, and to own her own home in the city of Ayacucho and Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Diudora es casada, tiene 35 aÃ±os y 2 hijos, Diudora tiene una tienda de repuestos para carros en la Av. Arenales y su esposo tiene un taller de reparaciones para carros.

AdemÃ¡s Diudora tiene una empresa de transportes que viaja a las comunidades del Distrito de Acosvinchos y tiene 3 carros. Diudora tiene proyectado formar una empresa de transportes interprovincial.

loan.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina Gonzales is considered a hard working, honest, understanding woman and a good mother. She is married to Mr. Teodulo Rivera San Roman who is a general assistant to a carpenter. They have three children; Eliud Geovane is single and 22 years old, Kelia is 15 years old and a high school student, and Sara Janai is 8 years old and is in primary school. They all live at home.

She started her business to be able to move ahead and help her son finish school and also help her husband with the expenses of the home and satisfy her personal needs. She started out 15 years ago selling fabric that one her brothers would send to her from the city of San Luis Potosi. Later, a friend invited her to sell cosmetic products; this was in May of 1998. She started selling these products to her existing customers, neighbors and family members. With this income she was able to help her son finish high school.

She is now requesting a loan of USD $300 which she will repay in 4 months to supply the orders that her customers place and have a larger variety to offer to her prospective customers. With your support Bernardina will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

IniciÃ³ el negocio por deseos de salir adelante y lograr que su hijo terminara la secundaria asÃ­ como poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y poder satisfacer sus necesidades personales. loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina has belonged to the Communal Bank of Love and Truth for five years.

Karina is 24 years old and lives with her partner and her two sons. She sells clothes in a store in the â€œ12th of Aprilâ€ Market, and she acquires her merchandise in Lima. Besides this, she sells â€œchichaâ€ (a corn-based liquor) and ice creams typical of the area called â€œMuyuchiâ€ (made of sesame, milk, sugar and ice.) She carries out her sales in the main park of Ayacucho and also in the Santa Clara market.

Karina needs a loan of 2000 soles ($750 US) that she will invest in the purchase of jerseys, jeans, lingerie, robes and diapers.

Karina dreams of having a large car for city transportation, her own house, and that her sons will be good people.

loan.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina has belonged to the Communal Bank of Love and Truth for ten years.

She is a 48-year-old single mother with one daughter. She travels to different fairs in the region two times per week where she sells groceries, fruit, and breads. She buys cheese at the fair that she then resells in the F. Vivanco Market.

Justina needs a loan of 2500 soles ($925 US) that she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, noodles, flour, cookies, breads and various fruits.

Justinaâ€™s dreams are for her daughter to become a good professional, to make progress with the business, and to have a permanent store in the city of Ayacucho.

loan.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina considers herself a loving, friendly and very hard-working person. She is married to Francisco RodrÃ­guez Peralta who works as a security guard at a local restaurant. They have three children: Alondra Soley, aged 12, and a secondary student; Liliana Itzel aged 10 and at primary school and Anahi, aged 2.

She started her business because there was a time in which her husband was unable to find work and they had a lot of expenses, so that she put herself to work in any and every area, including cleaning houses. Later on their situation improved when her husband found a good job and they were even able to obtain a small social-interest house, which motivate her even more to establish a business in order to be able to cover all the household expenses.

Beginning in May 2004, as the woman she used to work for already used to give her used clothes in good condition which she would sell to her neighbours, she saw that it would be a good idea to begin to sell in the walking markets in nearby neighbourhoods. So she investigated where you could buy clothing in bulk and a neighbour contacted her with the name of someone in the town of Reynosa. This contact sends clothing packs to her when she needs stock.

Delfina is asking for a loan of $300 USD, which she will repay in 4 months in order to buy more clothes that she will be able to sell in the local markets and in this way increase her income.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Tienen 3 hijos Alondra Suley de 12 aÃ±os, estudiante de Secundaria; Liliana Itzel de 10 aÃ±os, estudiante de primaria y AnahÃ­ de 2 aÃ±os.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank â€œLove and Truthâ€ for 10 years.

Juana is 47 years old. She is married with 9 children, and 5 of them live with her. Juana travels to different fairs in the region three times a week to buy pigs and sheep, which she then raises for butchering. Later, she sells the meat at wholesale in the Santa Clara market and she also sells it from house to house.

Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $737.00 US). This money will be invested in the purchase of cattle, goats, and pigs.

Juanaâ€™s dreams are for her children to become professionals, to build another house, and to improve her business.

loan.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia PÃ©rez considers herself a reserved person, but very responsible and hard-working. She is married to Carlos GÃ³mez GarcÃ­a. They have two sons, Carlos Alberto aged 9, a primary school student, and Brenda Guadalupe, aged 3.

She started her business due to the need to increase her familyâ€™s income as her husbandâ€™s salary was already frequently not enough to make ends meet: this motivate her to establish her business.

She started-up in February 2003: she was on Vacation in the town of Reynosa, with her sister, who took her to a flea market where she had the idea of buying used or semi-new clothing in bulk to sell in Tampico in order to obtain an income. It was her sister who introduced her to a friend in Reynosa who sold stock more cheaply, and so she was able to increase her profits. She first began selling clothes alone from her house, then in a market close to where she lived and now she is established at several markets in Tampico, which has gone very well.

She is asking for a loan of $300 USD which will be repaid in 4 months in order to buy packs of used seasonal clothing which will help her to have a better variety of stock to offer to her customers and in the market.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Alejandra's Group

texts.es:
Silvia, Eva, and Alejandra have belonged to the Community Bank of Love and Truth for two years, eight months, and eight years respectively.

Silvia is twenty-nine years old and married with two children. She works as an artisan with a loom, completing jobs such as making blankets in different sizes which she sells in the market F. Vivanco. Silvia and her husband also go to fairs where they sell agrochemicals, chemicals that improve the production of crops.

On the other hand, Eva is 35 years old, in a long-term relationship, and has three children. With her partner she has a workshop where they make wool â€œbuzos,â€ baby clothes that cover the whole body and close with a central zipper. Eva and her partner sell their handiwork in different fairs in the Ayacucho region. Eva also sells assorted fabrics at the fairs.

Alejandra is 60 years old, married, and has 10 children, five of which live with her. She is a walking vendor who sells meat at the Nery Garcia market.

Silvia, Eva, and Alejandra need loans of 450 soles (approx. $167 US), 1250 soles (approx. $463 US), and 1000 soles (approx. $370 US) respectively. They will use the money to buy yarn, dye, wool, padlocks, batteries, sheep, and hogs.

The dreams of Silvia, Eva, and Alejandra are to improve their businesses, to increase their capital, and to see their children become skilled professionals.

loan.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma has belonged to the the Banco Comunal Legion for 3 years now.

Norma lives with her partner, she is 26 years old and has two children. Together with her husband, she has a restaurant called "Huan Ching," located near the Nery Garcia market. Recently, Norma opened a new restaurant on a central street of the city Ayacucho.

She needs a loan of 3,000 soles, money which will be invested in purchasing display cases and tables to be used at the new site.

Norma's dream is to have her own home, to see her businesses improve and to give her children a good education.

Los sueÃ±os de Norma son tener casa propia, sus negocios mejoren y que sus hijos tengan una buena educaciÃ³n.

loan.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela considers herself persevering, honest and very dedicated to her work. She is married to RamÃ³n Ortiz Gilberto who works as a construction worker. She has four children: JosÃ© Francisco ages 22 who is single, a student and disabled; Miriam, aged 19 and single; Celeste, aged 16, single and a high-school student and Gilberto, aged 12, a secondary-school student. They all live at home.

She established her business because she has always liked sales, and it also provided her with an independent income in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She began selling goods 20 years ago, firstly childrenâ€™s underwear among her neighbours, friends and family, then she sold catalogue beauty products and from February 2004 she began to sell new clothes, which she used to sell from home but now she operates from a customised space in the front of her house and which in the future she would like to convert to a boutique.

Now she would like a loan for $300 USD which she will repay in 4 months in order to buy new seasonal clothes which will allow her to have a better stock to satisfy her customers and in this way increase her earnings.

The dream of these three women is to have their own restaurant, a bigger business, a stable location and to build a house.

loan.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
MarÃ­a Magdalena started her business selling new and semi-new clothes 15 years ago with a small nest-egg she had, selling a few pieces in order to improve her householdâ€™s economic situation which at that time was very precarious as her husband works in transport and earns a low salary, and also to assure a dignified future for her 3 children which at that time were adolescents and are now 30, 25 and 24 years old.
