loan.name: Hacia Al Futuro Group

texts.en:
Nadege O. is a cheerful young woman who lives with her three children (ages: 4, 1, 3 months) and earns a living by sewing and mending dresses and other types of clothing. With this loan she wants to buy new fabric and material in order to continue making these dresses for women in her community. She is very skilled, and can sew dresses very quickly and professionally. Her dream for the future is to have a steady business that will help provide money for her children. The biggest obstacle she faces right now is finding an affordable room or building to run her business out of.

Many women in this community have just completed paying back their first loan, and this will be their second loan, as is the case with Nadege. For the other women, this is there first opportunity to obtain credit in order to improve their lives and care for their families. Esperanza wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders that make it possible for us to continually extend credit to these women. God bless!

loan.use: To buy new materials for making dresses.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Chicas De La Raza 2 Group

texts.es:
The group Chicas de la Raza 2 (Girls of Race) is made up of the following members: Elizabeth Margarita, Margarita Concepcion who sell clothing for men, women and children and Mrs. Maria Gabriela who learned as a young child how to makes sweets and traditional cakes from her grandmother in the region of San Cristobal de Las Casa, which she sells to established businesses in the center of town. She is 38 years old, the mother of four and with this loan she will invest in purchasing more flour, eggs and all other items necessary to continue fabricating her bakery items.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

EL GRUPO CHICAS DE LA RAZA 2 LO FORMAN: ELIZABTH MARGARITA, MARGARITA CONCEPCION QUE SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE ROPA PARA TODA LA FAMILIA Y DOÃ‘A MARIA GABRIELA DESDE MUY PEQUEÃ‘A APRENDIO DE SU ABUELA HACER DULCES Y PASTELES TRADICIONALES DE LA REGION DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS, ENTREGA A LOS LOCALES COMERCIALES ESTABLECIDOS EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. ELLA TIENE 38 AÃ‘OS, CUATRO HIJOS, CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE HARINA, HUEVOS Y TODO LO NECESARIO PARA CONTINUAR CON LA PRODUCCION.

loan.use: To purchase flour and eggs to make cakes.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alternativa Solidaria Chiapas (AlSol) - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Chicas De La Raza 1 Group

texts.es:
Esmeralda del Carmen sells catalog products such as shoes, clothing, quilts and other home items. She began her business five years ago with some of her friends and neighbors and now many people know her and ask her for her products. She is 30 years old, the mother of two and belongs to a group called Chicas de la Raza (Girls of Race) 1, along with Mrs. Candelaria (who sells typical Mexican food), Teresa de Jesus ( who runs a grocery store) and Francisca de Jesus (who runs a butcher shop). With their loans, they will invest in the growth of their businesses and in this way be able to contribute to the household economy.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ESMERALDA DEL CARMEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS POR CATALOGO COMO: ZAPATOS, ROPA, EDREDONES, ARTICULOS PARA EL HOGAR. SU NEGOCIO LO INICIO HACE CINCO AÃ‘OS CON AMIGOS Y VECINOS, ACTUALMENTE MUCHA GENTE LA CONOCE Y PREGUNTAN POR LOS PRODUCTOS QUE VENDE. ELLA TIENE 30 AÃ‘OS, DOS HIJOS Y PERTENECE AL GRUPO LLAMADO CHICAS DE LA RAZA 1 JUNTO CON DOÃ‘A CANDELARIA (VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO), PETRA JOSEFA (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS), YULIANA DEL CARMEN (VENTA DE COMIDA TIPICA), TERESA DE JESUS (TIENDA DE ABARROTES) Y FRANCISCA DE JESUS (TIENE UNA CARNICERIA). CON SUS PRESTAMOS INVERTIRAN PARA EL CRECIMIENTO DE SUS NEGOCIOS Y DE ESTA FORMA CONTRIBUIR PARA LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.

loan.use: To invest in the purchase of home products, clothing and shoes.

loan.name: Lupita

texts.es: â€œIt has been several months since I received my residence and now I would like to enlarge it a bit since the space that I have is very small. I know I will have to do a little at a time since my financial situation is very difficult. However, I will work so that I can have my house with more comforts and more spaceâ€ I am requesting USD $500 to enlarge my residence. Translated from Sapnish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer. â€œHace algunos meses que me entregaron mi vivienda, ahora me gustarÃ­a ampliarla un poco ya que el espacio que tengo es muy pequeÃ±o, se que tendrÃ© que hacerlo poco a poco ya que la situaciÃ³n econÃ³mica esta muy difÃ­cil, pero voy a trabajar para poder tener mi casa con mÃ¡s comodidades y mÃ¡s espacioâ€ Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para ampliar en mi vivienda.

loan.use: Construction of a room.

loan.name: Osbaldo

texts.es:
Osbaldo is the father of 2 children, 11 and 9, who are in school. He's long loved cars and motorcycles and he started a business buying and selling cars when he needed an income that would allow him to better support his family. He started it 7 years ago when he sold the family car for a good price and used the money to buy two cheaper cars that he later sold. He saw that this could be a good source of income with which he could provide for his family.

Osbaldo is now applying for a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to pay off a loan on a motorcycle that he bought. With your support, Osbaldo can continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Osbaldo es padre de 2 hijos de 11 y 9 aÃ±os que son estudiantes. Inicio el negocio de compra-venta de autos dado su gusto por los automÃ³viles y motocicletas, ya que requerÃ­a tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera sacar adelante a su familia. Esto lo inicio hace 7 aÃ±os cuando vendiÃ³ el carro familiar a un buen precio y con este dinero compro otros dos de menor recio que despuÃ©s vendiÃ³ y vio que de esto era una buena fuente de ingresos con la que podrÃ­a cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Ahora solicita un crÃ©dito por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para terminar de liquidar una motocicleta que adquiriÃ³. Con tu apoyo Osbaldo seguirÃ¡ adelante.

loan.use: Buy a motorcycle.

loan.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria is divorced and has 3 children, 19, 14, and 9, all still in school. When her husband left her, she had to find a way to support her children and especially to be able to send them to school. Six years ago, she started selling cold drinks and food to the truckers who passed by on a local road. She found out from them that they needed a place to bath and wash and iron their clothes so she decided to offer those services. She now wants to buy used clothes to resell to her customers.

Maria is asking for a US$775 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy used clothes for resale. With your help, this enterprising woman will be able to build on her success.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Ma. Guadalupe es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 19,14 y 9 aÃ±os, todos ellos estudiantes. Cuando su esposo la abandono ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar una forma de mantener a sus hijos, sobretodo poder darles educacion. Hace 6 aÃ±os inicio vendiendo refrescos y tortas a los transportistas que pasaban por esta carretera y se entero por ellos mismos de la necesidad que tenÃ­an ellos de baÃ±arse, lavar y planchar su ropa, por lo que ella decidiÃ³ ofrecerles sus servicios. Ahora tambiÃ©n quiere comprara ropa usada para venderla a sus clientes.

Para ello solicita un crÃ©dito por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara la ropa usada y venderla. Con tu ayuda esta mujer emprendedora podrÃ¡ seguir progresando.

loan.use: Buy clothes for resale.

loan.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto is divorced and has 2 children, 25 and 22. He started his business when he decided to leave the state of Guerrero for Queretaro. Three years ago, he realized that he could set up a seafood business, something common in his hometown and a business he knew very well. From his trailer, he makes a living selling seafood, offering his products in various cities.

Alberto is now applying for a US$250 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, he will be able to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

JosÃ© Alberto es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 22 aÃ±os. Inicio su negocio cuando decidiÃ³ dejar el estado de Guerrero para irse a vivir a QuerÃ©taro, hace 3 aÃ±os entonces se dio cuenta que podÃ­a poner un negocio de mariscos que es comÃºn en su ciudad natal, por lo que el conocÃ­a perfecto del tema, en su remolque se dedico a venderlos ofreciÃ©ndolos en diversas ciudades.

Ahora solicita un crÃ©dito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara mercancÃ­a. Con tu apoyo don Alberto saldrÃ¡ adelante.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is married and has 3 children, 16, 13 and 7. She started her business because her husband's income wasn't stretching far enough to cover the family's expenses. She has always enjoyed sales because she looks at it as an opportunity to do something that helps to add to the family's income. She started, 8 years ago, selling cold drinks, fried foods and snacks to her neighbors. Little by little, she built a store where she now sells groceries, fresh fruits and vegetables.

Maribel is applying for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, Maribel will make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Maribel es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16,13 y 7 aÃ±os. Inicio su negocio porque con el sueldo de su marido no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares. A ella siempre le han gustado las ventas por lo que vio una oportunidad para hacer algo relacionado que le ayudara a complementar los ingresos familiares. Hace 8 aÃ±os empezÃ³ vendiendo refrescos, frituras y golosinas entre sus vecinos. Y poco a poco formo una tienda donde ahora vende abarrotes, frutas y verduras.

Ahora solicita un crÃ©dito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprara mercancÃ­a. Con tu ayuda Maribel harÃ¡ crecer su negocio.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin is married and has two children, 7 and 3. He started the business because he needed an extra income to pay for operations that his children, both of whom were born with heart problems, had to have. His income before didn't cover all their expenses and his wife couldn't work because she had to care for the young patients. Though the kids are better today, they still need medical care. The business started 6 years ago with the sale of used clothes brought from the United States. Martin later expanded the business, adding new clothes, accessories, gifts, etc., which now generate larger revenues.

Martin is applying for a US$950 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to stock the business. With your help, Martin can continue his business and his children can continue to receive the medical treatment they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Martin E. es casado y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 aÃ±os. IniciÃ³ el negocio Por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso extra, ya que sus dos hijos nacieron con problemas en el corazÃ³n, y requerÃ­an de varias operaciones, y con lo que el ganaba no le alcanzaba, ademÃ¡s su esposa no podÃ­a apoyar al gasto familiar ya que cuidaba a los dos menores enfermos, hoy en dÃ­a aunque estÃ¡n mejor aun reciben atenciÃ³n medica. El negocio comenzÃ³ hace 6 aÃ±os con la venta de ropa usada que traÃ­a de Estados Unidos. Posteriormente fue incrementando su negocio con la venta de ropa nueva, accesorios, regalos, etc. Y actualmente esto le genera mejores ingresos.

Solicita un crÃ©dito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para mantener surtido y estable el negocio. Con tu ayuda Martin seguirÃ¡ con su negocio y sus hijos no suspenderÃ¡n el tratamiento medico.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Ruben

texts.es:
â€œI have tried to improve my home but, in fact, the financial situation is very difficult. I would like to build two fences in the patio. The houses in the projects where I live are publicly subsidized and the space is very limited. As you can see in the picture, there is little privacy as they are built one right next to the other. I am requesting $800 to build the fences in the backyard of my house.â€

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

â€œHe tratado de hacerle mejoras a mi vivienda, pero en realidad la situaciÃ³n econÃ³mica esta muy difÃ­cil. Me gustarÃ­a levantar dos bardas en el patio, ya que las casas del fraccionamiento en donde vivo son de interÃ©s social, el espacio es muy reducido y, como pueden ver en la foto, tienen muy poca privacidad, ya que estÃ¡n construidas muy pegadas. Solicito 800 dÃ³lares para levantar dos bardas en el patio de mi vivienda.â€

loan.use: Build fences in the backyard of my house.

loan.name: Sandra

texts.es:
â€œSome months ago I finished the construction of a room in my home. Now I only need to plaster the walls and install tile flooring. I have worked hard to be able to build this room, but my savings are gone and I donâ€™t have the capital needed to finish the construction. For this reason, I am requesting $1000 for the plastering and flooring.â€

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

â€œHace algunos meses terminÃ© la construcciÃ³n de un cuarto en mi vivienda. Ahora solo me falta enjarrar las paredes y poner vitropiso. He trabajado mucho para poder hacer este cuarto, pero mis ahorros ya se terminaron y no tengo capital para terminar la construcciÃ³n. Por eso solicito 1,000 dÃ³lares para enjarrar las paredes y poner vitropiso en un cuarto de mi vivienda.â€

loan.use: Wall plastering and flooring of a room.

loan.name: Percibal

texts.es:
â€œIn the projects where I live the houses are publicly subsidized. If you can tell by the picture, houses are built one right next to the other, only separated by an exterior hallway. I would like to build fences to make my house safer, as presently it can be easily broken into, and I donâ€™t want to expose my family. I am requesting $400 to build the fences.â€

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

â€œEn el fraccionamiento donde vivo las casas son de interÃ©s social. Si se dan cuenta por la foto, las casas estÃ¡n pegadas una con la otra y solo las divide un pasillo. Me gustarÃ­a levantar las bardas para darle mÃ¡s seguridad a mi vivienda, ya que por cualquier parte se pueden meter y no quiero exponer a mi familia. Solicito 400 dÃ³lares para levantar las bardas del patio de mi vivienda.â€

loan.use: Build a fence in the backyard of my house.

loan.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Ever since moving to her current home and since her only child started school, Modesta has felt it was time to find an activity to fill her spare time. It was important that she found something which meant she was rarely far away from her house, so that she could look after her home and child in the afternoons. With the aim of improving her economic situation, Modesta decided to open a small shop. Today, four years down the line, it is a grocery store. She is proud to see how her business has grown, since when she started she had nothing. In time, she wants to extend her premises and offer more products.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Desde que se mudo a su actual vivienda y desde que su Ãºnico hijo, en ese entonces de cinco aÃ±os, ingreso al colegio, Modesta creyÃ³ necesario ocuparse en una actividad en sus tiempos libres. Una actividad que no la alejara tampoco de su casa pues aun tenÃ­a que ocuparse de su hogar y de su hijo por las tardes. Con la idea de progresar y mejorar su situaciÃ³n econÃ³mica, Modesta se animo a brir una pequeÃ±a tienda. Hoy en dÃ­a ya lleva cuatro aÃ±os en su bodega. Ella cuenta sentirse orgullosa al ver cÃ³mo ha crecido su negocio, ya que cuando empezÃ³ no tenÃ­a casi nada. En un tiempo, ella quisiera ampliar su local e implementarlo con otro rubro de productos.

loan.use: She wishes to offer beauty products in her store

loan.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina is a hard-working woman and since the age of 18 she has worked in a ceramics workshop. Helping her husband and her brother-in-law, she started to learn about the ceramic trade, learning how to create different decorative ornaments. In time, she became an expert; nevertheless, keeping up a job and running a household was very hard for her. This is why she left her job to open a business from home. She realised that she could make a success of selling office and school equipment and so that is what she did. Today, she has been running her bookshop for three years and thankfully it is all going well. In the future she would like to install a mini ceramic workshop so that she can continue to create ornaments and so that her children have a secure business when they finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Constantina es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde los dieciocho aÃ±os ha trabajado en un taller de cerÃ¡mica. Ayudando a su esposo y a su cuÃ±ado empezÃ³ a aprender el oficio de trabajar la cerÃ¡mica para producir diversos objetos de ornamento. Con el paso del tiempo ha llegado a especializarse en este oficio; no obstante, mantenerse en ese trabajo y a la vez ocuparse de los quehaceres del hogar fue muy pesado para ella. Es asÃ­ que detuvo su trabajo para abrir un negocio en su misma casa. Se le ocurriÃ³ que tendrÃ­a Ã©xito vendiendo Ãºtiles para oficina y colegio si es que se lo proponÃ­a. Y asÃ­ lo hizo. Actualmente lleva tres aÃ±os con su librerÃ­a y felizmente le estÃ¡ yendo bien. MÃ¡s adelante ella quisiera implementar un mini taller de cerÃ¡mica para seguir produciendo adornos y tambiÃ©n para que sus hijos, al terminar el colegio, tengan un oficio seguro.

loan.use: To buy the necessary tools for her ceramic workshop

loan.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
One of Estherâ€™s friends encouraged her to invest in a business selling beauty products. To decided to go ahead, because at that time there were problems at home and she was looking for new ways to generate income. For a while she had been cleaning houses, washing clothes and kitchens of her various customers. Today, she only does this for short periods, one or two days, or on the weekends. Everything she earns goes towards her five children; since despite the fact that her husband also works as a driver, they often need more income. This is why, until she finds a more stable job she is going to continue to put all her efforts into developing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Una amiga de Esther la animÃ³ a invertir en el negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Ella decidiÃ³ aceptar, porque en aquel momento pasaba por algunos problemas en su casa y buscaba otras formas de generar ingresos al hogar. Muy aparte, desde hace un tiempo ella ofrece servicios de limpieza a casas, de lavado de ropa y de cocina a diversos clientes. Actualmente, solo lo hace por temporadas pequeÃ±as, un dÃ­a dos dÃ­as o los fines de semana. Las ganancias que ella obtiene de su arduo trabajo van dirigidas a sus cinco hijos; ya que, a pesar, de que su esposo tambiÃ©n trabaja siendo chofer, muchas veces se necesita mÃ¡s de un ingreso en la familia; por ello, hasta que encuentre un trabajo mÃ¡s estable seguirÃ¡ poniendo todo su empeÃ±o para crecer en su negocio.

loan.use: To buy more stock

loan.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa runs a shoe shop. Before this, she worked selling shoes in a market, in a relativeâ€™s shop. This is where she learned about the trade. After a while, she left her job to work for herself and tried to set up a business selling clothes. After a year she decided to branch out into selling other items for women. On moving to San Martin from Porres she decided to join forces with another relative and return to try her luck with a shoe business. Luckily, it all worked out and now she has almost been in business for a year. Luisa states that she feels ready for anything, always looking for ways to develop, not only for herself but for the sake of her three young children

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El actual negocio de la seÃ±ora Luisa es su zapaterÃ­a. Anteriormente ella ha trabajado como zapatera dentro de un mercado en el negocio de un familiar. Es ahÃ­ donde aprende el oficio del calzado. DespuÃ©s de haber trabajado un tiempo se independizÃ³ e intento hacer negocio en la confecciÃ³n de ropa. Durante un aÃ±o ella se dedicÃ³ a aplicarle acabados a distintas prendas para mujeres. Al momento de mudarse a San Martin de Porres ella decide juntarse con otro familiar y volver a probar suerte en un negocio de calzado. Felizmente le fue bien y ahora esta a punto de cumplir un aÃ±o en su local. Luisa afirma que se siente capaz de todo buscando siempre el progreso, no solo por ella sino tambiÃ©n por sus tres menores hijos.

loan.use: To improve her service, selling women clothes and products

loan.name: David

texts.es:
The purchase and sale of sheep and cows has always been the work of David and his family. As a young father, he was responsible, along his wife and eight-year-old child, for the future of this business. Not too long ago things were going very well, both with his family and business. Unfortunately his loving wife became ill. This grieved him, but at the same time it gave him strength to continue sacrificing to gain money to cover the costs of his wife's medical bills so that she would recover quickly. David would like to take advantage of the large expanse of property that he inherited from his parents. He hopes to increase his capital in order to invest in his business while at the same time dedicating himself to the growing of vegetables. He promises to give this endeavor his best in order to see his business grow and to ensure his wife's complete recovery. With your kind heart he will realize this wish in short time.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad de compra y venta de ganado ovino y vacuno siempre ha sido la labor de don David y su amada familia, Ã©l como padre joven y vigoroso trata de sacar adelante este negocio y a travÃ©s de el a su pequeÃ±a niÃ±a Janeth de 8 aÃ±itos y a su querida esposa NoemÃ­.Hasta hace poco tiempo todo le iba de maravillas, tanto en el Ã¡mbito familiar como en su negocio, desafortunadamente su amada esposa enfermÃ³, este hecho lo acongojÃ³ pero al mismo tiempo le dio mayor fortaleza para seguir esforzÃ¡ndose a fin de tratar de reunir dinero para seguir cubriendo los gastos de medicamentos de su esposa para su pronta recuperaciÃ³n.David desea sacar provecho a la gran extensiÃ³n de propiedades que heredÃ³ de sus padres, con ese fin desea aumentar el monto de su capital para invertirlo en su negocio de compra y venta de ganado y al mismo tiempo dedicarse a la producciÃ³n de vegetales.AsÃ­ mismo promete poner lo mejor de sÃ­ para cumplir su propÃ³sito de ver florecer su negocio y ver totalmente recuperada a su amada esposa, con tu buen corazÃ³n este anhelo se concretarÃ¡ en un corto tiempo.

loan.use: To invest capital to increase production

loan.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth and her beloved partner, Juan, make a happy couple. It has been eight years since their marriage, and during this time they have made a great sacrifice to build their home. They wanted to offer their three children a proper home and to maintain a small plot of land to raise and nourish their animals. These animals have made them appreciate nature, and beyond the raising of animals and the production of cheese they also purchase and sell calves. With these labors they are gaining their day to day subsistence and bettering their way of life. At the same time they are able to support their humble and aging parents and repay them for their own efforts to support their own children. Janeth and her husband's wish is to obtain a loan in order to invest in the purchase of fodder for their animals. They believe that with your kind heart they will realize their wish.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Janeth y su querido y ejemplar compaÃ±ero, Juan, conforman una feliz pareja de esposos, hace sÃ³lo 8 aÃ±os contrajeron matrimonio, en ese tiempo con sumo trabajo y dedicaciÃ³n lograron construir su casita para ofrecerles un hogar propio a sus 3 pequeÃ±os niÃ±os y comprar un terrenito para criar y alimentar a sus tiernos animalitos.La familia de esta laboriosa ha inculcado en ellos el amor y la valoraciÃ³n por la naturaleza, ademÃ¡s de la crianza de animales y fabricaciÃ³n de quesos con la leche que extraen de sus generosas vaquitas, ahora se dedican a la compra y venta de becerritas, con estas labores estÃ¡n logrando dÃ­a a dÃ­a mejorar su calidad de vida y al mismo tiempo contribuir con sus humildes y ancianos padres en contribuciÃ³n al apoyo y bienestar que recibieron de ellos.El deseo de Janeth y su esposo es conseguir un prÃ©stamo para invertirlos en la compra de forraje para sus vaquitas. EstÃ¡n seguros que con tu buen corazÃ³n contribuirÃ¡ con su gran anhelo.

loan.use: To purchase fodder to nourish their cows

loan.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
The district of Umachiri is located 3.904 meters above sea level. It is a zone well known for its stock farming, and Alejandro's family is well-acquainted with this honest work. They have dedicated themselves to this work for many years. Alejandro was once a carpenter, but after realizing that carpentry did not yield enough money to cover his familial costs he decided to become a stock farmer. After great effort and dedication he decided to invest his savings in the purchase of cows and sheep. Since Alejandro must leave very early in the morning to feed his cows, his lovely wife is left to care for their 4 young children and to watch over the sheep as they pasture around the limits of their humble home. This family's wish is to obtain fodder for the nourishment of their animals. They believe that by providing good care, safekeeping, and nutrition their animals will in turn provide a large quantity of milk for the production of cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El distrito de Umachiri estÃ¡ ubicado a unos 3904 msnm, es una zona eminentemente ganadera y la familia de don Alejandro no es ajena a esta noble labor, ellos desde muy temprano se dedican a cumplir esta sacrificada labor al mismo tiempo complaciente actividad de producciÃ³n y pastoreo.Anteriormente don Alejandro se dedicaba a la carpinterÃ­a, pero al ver que no lograba cubrir todos sus gastos familiares con este trabajo decidiÃ³ dedicarse a la producciÃ³n de ganado, es por ello que con esfuerzo, dedicaciÃ³n y mucho mÃ¡s empeÃ±o logrÃ³ juntar un capital para adquirir vaquitas y ovejitas.Mientras Alejandro desde muy temprano abandona su hogar para alimentar a sus vaquitas su amada esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus 4 pequeÃ±os niÃ±os y a pastar a sus ovejitas por los alrededores de su humilde casita.El deseo de esta familia es adquirir forraje para la alimentaciÃ³n de sus animalitos, ellos consideran que brindÃ¡ndoles un buen cuidado, dedicaciÃ³n y nutriciÃ³n sus vaquitas les proveerÃ¡ de una buena cantidad de leche para la elaboraciÃ³n de quesos.

loan.use: To purchase fodder to improve the nutrition of their animals

loan.name: Julia

texts.es:
Ms Julia is a mother of 5 children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Despite her advanced age, she continues to give her best in order to help her family. Ever since she was a young girl she learned the honest work of stock farming and agriculture, a knowledge she has passed downed to her own children who have also managed to improve their quality of life. Ms Julia and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow. After a number of sacrifices they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce delicious cheeses. They sell these on the weekends in the city of Ayaviri. As a result of the inclement weather, they have decided to purchase and store fodder for the nourishment of their animals. It is with this end that they ask for your generous help.

loan.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma is a relatively young woman, full of energy and with a lot of desire to work and begin new businesses. She has spent ten years working in her older sister's sewing and baking workshop. At the beginning she was not a part of the business until five years ago when she had the idea to implement a baking workhop into the textile sewing services. Due to this, the time that she spends in the workshop is greater. She is thankful to her sister for giving her this opportunity but she currently plans to open her own workshop in her home because being outside of her house all day impedes her from taking care of her 8 year old son. Aside from this, she also is thinking of becoming a distributor for gas for cooking. For all of this she countson the support of her husband, working as a bricklayer, is in charge of the home maintenance.

Ella actualmente lleva diez aÃ±os trabajando en el taller de teÃ±idos y confecciÃ³n de su hermana mayor. Al inicio no formaba parte de la empresa, hasta que hace cinco aÃ±os ideo implementar el taller de confecciÃ³n con el servicio de tenidos de textiles tambiÃ©n. loan.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Ms Martina and her husband Gregorio's small and humble home is located more than 3904 meters above sea level in the district of Umachiri. They built their home more than 11 years ago. As a consequence of their love, they care for three enchanting children who are the reason for their efforts in their daily labor.

At the moment Gregorio and his family live in his aging parents' home. It is his responsibility to provide for his parents' well-being and tranquility in the last years of their lives. Gregorio and his hard-working wife have always dedicated themselves to raising livestock, and with the profits that they have obtained they are providing their children with an education. In order to increase their economic revenue they intend to genetically invigorate their cows by artificially inseminating them. This will improve the production of milk.

Your indispensable contribution will help this family realize its wishes.

loan.name: Mauro

He was unable to complete secondary school because of his parentsâ€™ financial situation. This is why, since he formed his own family, he has been producing livestock, an activity that is helping to improve their quality of life and their family home. Mauroâ€™s greatest desire is to give his family security and their own roof â€“ this is why he is asking you to find it in your heart to give them a loan, so that he can finish the project that he already started. Mauro and his family are waiting for help from you.

loan.name: Irma Zonia

texts.es:
With the prior experience of trying out natural medicine products on her son when he was ill, she decided to market them and sell them with the goal of generating more income for her home. However, Sonia does not only work at selling natural remedies but she also has gotten together with a group of friends to offer catering for various events.

Even though it would be enough for anybody to work at two jobs, Sonia does not know the meaning of the word tiredness and decided that she could and had time for one more task; she is willing to work at whatever she need to. This is how, in addition to her two small businesses, she sells typical Peruvian food on the weekends outside of her home. Sonia is definitely a woman and mother that is capable of many things that is why she is currently planning to open a restaurant in a strategic place with her family. This is not only to generate income but also give steady work to her friends.

When it comes to her family life, she is very happy to be able provide her two minor children with the education that they need. She is also happy in being able to count on her husbandâ€™s support in all her projects, including the culmination of the construction of her house.

loan.name: Luis

He wants to improve the financial situation of his family and give his 3 kids a good education. This is why he perseveres every day. He would now like to buy some roughage so that his animals will eat well in all seasons. With this project in mind, Luis is asking for your help.

loan.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra has a snackbar where she sells fried foods prepared in different ways. She began the business 3 years ago. At first, she helped a friend sell tostadas. Bit by bit, she saved what she made until, 2 years ago, she had saved enough to start a business of her own at home. She's married with 3 children, 10, 8, and 5, and her husband is a "comerciante" (merchant or shopkeeper, perhaps). She wants to help her husband with household expenses and so provide a better quality of life for their children.

She's now applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy new merchandise that her customers have asked for such as cold drinks and sweets.

Norma is applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and generate more sales. With your help, Norma can move ahead.

Juana is now applying for a US$400 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your contribution, Juana will prosper.

loan.name: Martha

Martha started a small general store 3 years ago. Her husband was laid off and they set up the business with some of the money he received from his employer. She felt that it was necessary to do something for the family expenses when she knew that her husband would be out of work for a while. Thanks to her hard work, thing have gone very well but she'd like to have a larger business and she needs loans for that.

Martha is asking for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise and have more stock on hand so that she can attract more customers. With your help, Martha can meet her goal.

loan.name: Asuncion

While he was paying off the expenses, he made the decision to start his own business so that he could spend more time with his wife. Nine years ago, he began selling iced deserts and fresh fruit that to this day have provided him a good income and a way to pay for all he needs.

Asuncion is applying for a US$775 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy basic ingredients for his food business because he expects his sales to go up as the weather gets warmer over the coming months. He hopes that with Kiva's support, he'll get the loan.

His greatest desire is to provide a full education for his 4 kids, a chance he never got due to his parentsâ€™ lack of money, and it is with this goal in mind that he works hard every day. Producing livestock and making delicious cheeses has become the main and indispensable income for Leonidasâ€™ family. loan.name: Juan

Their education is the most important inheritance Eulalia and her husband, Lucio, can give to their dear kids. Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La educaciÃ³n es la mejor herencia que desean brindarles doÃ±a Eulalia y su esposo Lucio a sus queridos hijos, ambos son padres muy responsables dedicados a la agricultura y ganaderÃ­a, se esfuerzan y perseveran con el fin D. darles la oportunidad D. concluir estudios superiores a sus 4 retoÃ±os, oportunidad que ellos nunca tuvieron por sus bajos recursos econÃ³micos.Esta feliz madre desD. que formÃ³ su familia se dedica a la agricultura y con el apoyo D. su incondicional esposo a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, gracias a los ingresos que perciben por esta actividad es que estÃ¡n logrando cubrir sus necesidades mÃ¡s urgentes.Pero ahora que sus gastos van en aumento desea solicitar un prÃ©stamo para incrementar su capital D. trabajo y por enD. su radio D. acciÃ³n.Eulalia y su familia se encuentran en espera D. tÃº pronta respuesta.

loan.use: To increase capital in order to increase their production/Incremento de capital de trabajo para incrementar su radio de acciÃ³n.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Julia

texts.es:
Since she moved into her current home, Julia has been trying her luck with different types of businesses, such as a general store, clothing sales, selling food from her house, etc. When she was dismissed from her job at the end of the 1980's, she has always tried to find a way to generate income to help cover the costs of her home. Despite the fact that her husband works as a driver, they have generally needed extra income for any emergency that always seem to happen.

Currently, Julia works to prepare food according to the orders that people ask her for. This is not daily work and this allows her to work lending her domestic services in a residential area of Lima as well. Her dream is to get capital and invest in a big business. All of this is with the goal of being able to give a good education to her daughters, ages 20 and 14.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Desde que se mudÃ³ a su actual vivienda, Julia ha estado probando suerte en distintos tipos de negocio, ya sea en bodega, venta de ropas, vendiendo comida en su casa, etc. Cuando la despidieron de su trabajo a fines de los ochentas, siempre ha visto el modo de cÃ³mo generar recursos que ayuden a cubrir los gastos de su casa. A pesar de que su esposo trabaja como chofer, generalmente, siempre se necesita de un ingreso extra para cualquier emergencia que nunca faltan. Actualmente, Julia se ocupa de preparar comida segÃºn los pedidos que algunas personas le hacen. Este trabajo no es diario, es por esto que le permite trabajar tambiÃ©n prestando sus servicios domÃ©sticos en una zona residencial de Lima. Su sueÃ±o es obtener un buen capital de trabajo e invertir en un negocio grande, todo esto con el fin de poder darles una buena educaciÃ³n a sus hijas de 20 y 14 aÃ±os.

loan.use: Investment for a new business

loan.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 30 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 9 months and 7 years. Amina owns a small retail shop, which she started in 2001. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Pili and Mwanahamisi, who have businesses dealing in groceries.

loan.use: To buy more items for her business

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Habiba and Mwajuma, who have businesses dealing in Medical store and cloth sales.

Every day she works from 7:30 AM to 5:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loan.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina J., who comes from the small town of Raiwind, Pakistan, is married with two children: one girl and one boy. Both of her children attend a local school and she hopes that they will be able to do well so that they can find successful jobs in the future. Naginaâ€™s husband, who is a rickshaw driver, had an accident with his rickshaw, and now they are in need of a loan to get it fixed.

There are several other women in her loan group including: Rubina B., who wants to invest in her wheat business; Ramzana B., who wants to expand her wood business; Parween N., who wants to get her rickshaw fixed and Rehana B., who will buy a donkey cart.

loan.use: Fix a rickshaw

loan.name: Paulina's Imani Group

texts.en:
Paulina is 35 years old and is divorced with 3 children, ages 17, 10, and 5. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 14, 12, and 7. Paulina is a fruits (banana) seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Laurencia and Fatuma, who have businesses dealing in charcoal and food vending.

loan.use: To buy more fruits for her business

loan.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
My name is Khursheed Z. and I am from Raiwind, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of two girls and two boys. My eldest daughter is married and my eldest son embroiders clothes. There is currently a high demand for embroidered clothes, therefore we would like a loan to expand our business to take advantage of this growing business opportunity.

I am also the leader of my loan group that is comprised of the following women: Mussarat J. who sells cloth; Arshad B. who has a vegetable business; Amin B. who has a lumber yard business ; and Sakina B. who also has a vegetable business.

loan.use: Expand clothing embroidery business

loan.name: Annie's Group

texts.en:
My name is Annie J., I am married with six children, and I have lived all my life in Raiwind, Pakistan. As I did not receive education when I was young, I do not want the same fate to befall my kids. Therefore, I enrolled all my kids to school, all of whom have continued except for one son, who paints buildings. My husband is also a painter and paints buildings on contract. We would like to request a loan to buy paint brushes, a ladder and few other related items.

I have been joined in my loan group by several other women who are: Parween A., who needs a loan for her gas cylinders business; Shamim A., who is borrowing for her communications office; Suriya B., who wants to fix her carâ€™s engine; and Martha B. who will invest her share of loan in her lumber yard.

loan.use: Buy paint brushes, ladder and few other related items

loan.name: Sikia

texts.en:
Sikia is 30 years old and is single. She takes care of 3 people, ages 52, 16, and 12. Sikia is a cereals seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loan.use: To buy more items for her business

loan.name: Koser's Group

texts.en:
My name is Koser S. and I am the group leader of four women. We all reside in Raiwind, a small lush green town in Pakistan. I am a mother of two boys and one girl, all of whom attend school, except for my youngest son. Working from home, my main business activity is selling jewelry to the women of neighboring areas. As the high season for jewelry sales is commencing , I would like to request a loan to buy a stock of jewelry for my business. I would like to save a small portion of my monthly income to collect a dowry for my daughter, along with buying other furniture for my home.

My sub group members are: Koser A. who wants to buy cloth; Basheera B. who makes powdered salt; Mussarat B. who is in the livestock trade business and Shaheen B. who wants to buy construction supplies.

loan.use: Expand jewelry business

loan.name: Rukia's Upendo Center Group

texts.en:
Rukia is 35 years old and is divorced. She takes care of 1 person, age 56. Rukia is a firewood seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tajiri, who has a business dealing in fish selling.

loan.use: To buy more firewood for her business

loan.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en:
Balqees N. is married and a mother of two boys. Her eldest son attends a local school in grade two and she would like to see both her kids finish their schooling successfully. Balqees helps her brother-in-law to embroider and decorate clothes while her husband works as a sweeper at a local school. She is borrowing from Asasah, a microfinance institution, to invest in her brother-in-lawâ€™s embroidery business which gives her a reasonable monthly income.

The other women in her group who are also requesting loans include: Zeenat B., whose husband repairs roads; Rubina B. who sells cloth; and Haneefa B. who wants to buy construction supplies.

loan.use: Invest in a clothing embroidery business

loan.name: Mwanakombo

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loan.use: To buy more food items for her business.

texts.en:
Shazia A. S., born in Raiwind, Pakistan, is married and a mother of three: two boys and one girl. She belongs to a poor family but she has high hopes for her kids whom she plans to send to school. Her husband runs a small restaurant and they need a loan in order to improve their business.

Her loan group has several other women who would also like to improve their businesses: Rehana B. sells milk; Safia I. wants to buy animal fodder; Zainab B. would like to improve her familyâ€™s food stall and Shahnaz S. wants to buy a cow.

loan.use: Improve restaurant

loan.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
My name is Ramzana R. from Raiwind, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five: two boys and three girls. I would like all my kids to finish school. I embroider and sew clothes whereas my husband drives a tractor to transport sand and cement on order. The tyres of his tractor have deteriorated and we need to replace them.

I would like to request a loan for my group so that other women can also improve their businesses. Balqees B. sells dry fruits; Salma B. needs to fix her tractor; Kaneez B. wants to buy an electric loom (a machine used to manufacture cloth); Mamena B.â€˜s family operates an auto workshop; and Hussain B. would like to expand her tea stall.

loan.use: Buy new tyres for the tractor

loan.name: Asha's Magaoni Centre Group

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 19, 18, and 16. Asha is a cloth (khanga) seller; she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Ziada, who has a business dealing in chips selling.

loan.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loan.name: Sharifan's Group

texts.en:
Born in the small town of Kot Radha Kishan, Sharifan L. moved to the nearby town of Raiwind, Pakistan after her marriage. She is a mother of eight children, five boys and three girls, of which four are already married. She and her youngest daughter both embroider and sew bed sheets. She makes these bed sheets on order from a big cloth market in the city Lahore. Currently, she requires an additional embroidery machine in order to improve her services.

Her sub group members are Razia B. who runs a restaurant; Reshma B. and Zubaida B., who both required embroidery machines; and Najma B. who would like to expand her grocery store.

loan.use: Buy an additional embroidery machine

texts.en:
Zaina is 40 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 5 to 20. Zaina is a cloth seller; she started her business in 1998. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loan.use: To buy more cloth for her business

texts.en:

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loan.use: To buy more items for her business.

Bahati is 35 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 8 to 15. Bahati is a vegetables seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loan.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
My name is Mussarat A., I am married and a mother of seven children. I reside with my family in Raiwind, Pakistan where all my children attend a nearby school. Both my husband and I work, he runs a salon, while I am a health worker. I received one year training on health services under the government health programme. My husband would like to expand his business, thus we required a loan to buy more items for his salon.

My group has four other women who also require loans to expand their businesses: Zareen F. sells cloth; Koser S. needs to expand their restaurant; Rubina B. wants to buy wood and Kalsoom B. would like to start a fruit-selling business.

loan.use: Expand beauty salon

loan.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
My name is Halima A. and I am a mother of two girls and two boys. Originally from the city of Faisalabad, I moved to Raiwind, Pakistan twelve years ago. My eldest daughter is married and all my other children attend school. I am a health worker and provide health services for women at my clinic, located at a nearby market. Raiwin is a small city with few clinics, and I would like to expand my clinic.

My friends who also require loans for their businesses include: Suriya B., who will fix her tractor; Shahnaz M., who wants to buy a dairy cow; and Mumtaz M., who wants to expand her grocery store.

loan.use: Expand medical clinic

loan.name: Yulissa Beatriz's Group

texts.es:
Yulissa and Elisa have belonged to the Brilliant Communal Bank for 6 months and 1 year, 6 months respectively. They are from the community of Mollepata that this located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Yulissa lives in a shared home. She is 26 years old and has 3 children. Yulissa and her husband manufacture native bricks that they sell to distributors.

Meanwhile Elisa also lives in a shared home. She is 32 years old and has 1 daughter of 6 years. Elisa has a store where she sells meat, groceries and vegetables.

Yulissa and Elisa need loans of 900 soles and 600 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of firewood, rice, noodles, sugar and eggs.

The dreams of Yulissa and Elisa are to build their own houses, that their children become professionals and to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Yulissa y Elisa pertenecen al Banco Comunal Brillantes hace 6 meses, 1 aÃ±o, 6 meses respectivamente. Ellas son de la comunidad de Mollepata que esta ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Yulissa es conviviente, tiene 26 aÃ±os y 3 hijos, Yulissa junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales y lo venden a intermediarios.

Mientras que Elisa es conviviente, tiene 32 aÃ±os y 1 hija de 6 aÃ±os, Elisa tiene una tienda donde vende carne, abarrotes verduras.

Yulissa y Elisa necesitan prÃ©stamos de 900 soles, 600 soles, dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de leÃ±a, arroz, fideo, azÃºcar, huevo.

Los sueÃ±os de Yulissa y Elisa son construir su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar sus negocios.

loan.use: To buy firewood, rice, noodles, sugar and eggs for their brick and grocery businesses.

loan.name: Delia Gloria's Group

texts.es:
Marciana and Gloria have belonged to the Brilliant Communal for 6 months and 1 year, respectively. They are from the community of Mollepata that this located 20 minutes from of the city of Ayacucho.

Marciana lives in a shared home. She is 54 years old and has 9 children. Marciana has a store in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables and meats, an activity that she has carried out for 2 years.

Meanwhile Gloria also lives in a shared home. She is 37 years old and has 4 children. Glory sells firewood both wholesale and in smaller quantities. She carries out her sales by distributing to stores.

Marciana and Gloria need loans of 600 soles and 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, candles, noodles and firewood.

The dreams of Marciana and Gloria are that their children become professionals, to have more capital for their business and to build their own houses.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.name: Dora's Group

texts.es:
Teofila, Aleeda and Dora have belonged to the Sumaq Wasi (â€œPretty Houseâ€) Communal Bank for 6 months.

Teofila lives in a shared house. She is 28 years old and has 1 son of 4 years. Teofila sells food on foot. In addition, Teofila is a cashier in the city transportation department.

On the other hand, Aleeda is a single woman. She is 22 years old and is pregnant. Aleeda prepares decorative chocolates that she sells in institutions. In addition Aleeda has a family business selling wood. With the loan that she will obtain, she plans to fix up a family car for the transportation of the merchandise.

Meanshile Dora also lives in a shared house. She is 32 years old and has 5 children. Dora sells clothes to order. She sells her products to friends and family. In addition Dora works as housemaid in the mornings.

Teofila, Aleeda and Dora need loans of 1000 soles, 600 soles, and 600 soles; money that will be invested in the purchase of dishes, an oven, rice, sugar, polos, blouses, sweaters and for the repair of the car.

The dreams of Teofila, Aleeda and Dora are that their children study, to improve their economic situation and to have more supplies for their business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Teofila, Aleeda y Dora pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sumaq Wasi que significa â€œ Casa Bonitaâ€ hace 6 meses.

Teofila es conviviente, tiene 28 aÃ±o y 1 hijo de 4 aÃ±os, Teofila vende comida de manera ambulatoria. AdemÃ¡s Teofila es cobradora en las unidades de transporte urbano.

Por otro lado Aleeda es soltera, tiene 22 aÃ±os y esta embarazada, Aleeda prepara chocolates artesanales que vende en instituciones. AdemÃ¡s Aleeda tiene un negocio familiar de venta de maderas. Con el prÃ©stamo que obtendrÃ¡ tiene proyectado hacer arreglar un carro de su familia para el transporte de la mercaderÃ­a.

Mientras que Dora es conviviente, tiene 32 aÃ±os y 5 hijos, Dora vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los vende a amigos y familiares. AdemÃ¡s Dora por las maÃ±anas trabaja como empleada del hogar.

Teofila, Aleeda y Dora necesitan prÃ©stamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de platos, cocina, arroz, azÃºcar, polos, blusas, chompas y para la reparaciÃ³n del carro.

Los sueÃ±os de Teofila, Aleeda y Dora son que sus hijos estudien, mejorar su situaciÃ³n econÃ³mica y surtir mÃ¡s su negocio.

loan.use: To buy dishes, an oven, rice, sugar, polos, blouses, sweaters and for the repair of a car to transport merchandise.

loan.name: Raul

texts.es:
RaÃºl C. has always been a sales man; he has the ability to communicate well and to sell his products.

Some time ago he had to pay some extra home expenses and his salary was not enough. He therefore decided to sell calendars and business cards in order to get an extra income. That is how 8 years ago he started his own business printing and selling calendars and business cards. Ever since he has been able to cover his householdâ€™s expenses and get extra resources to pay for his childrenâ€™s education.

As he was an experienced seller and knows many people, he is able to sell most of the products he prints.

He now requests a loan of US $950 that he will pay within 6 months. This loan will allow him to print new calendars and business cards for which he has pending orders. As he will certainly sell those products, he will be able to quickly recover the money he will invest.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

RaÃºl C. iniciÃ³ el negocio ya que siempre ha trabajado en las ventas y tiene facilidad de palabra para poder colocar los productos que vende. Por eso se inclino a poner su propio negocio que le permitiera tener un ingreso extra para su familia. Tenia que pagar unos gastos de la casa y el dinero que sacaba en su empleo no le alcanzaba, por eso se puso a vender calendarios y tarjetas por su cuenta. De esa manera pudo obtener mas recursos para sacar adelante a su familia y sobre todo a sus hijos porque cada vez es mas difÃ­cil darles escuela.

ComenzÃ³ hace mas de 8 aÃ±os con el negocio de los almanaques y tarjetas, y ya traÃ­a yo cierta experiencia de ventas por esa razÃ³n como ya estaba empapado del negocio abriÃ³ su propio negocio y le ha ido muy bien porque conoce mucha gente y aprovecha para ofrecerles sus productos y logra colocar la mayorÃ­a de lo que produce.

Solicita un prÃ©stamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses. Este crÃ©dito le va a ayudar para sacar otro tiraje de tarjetas y almanaques que tiene pendientes, y como ya es segura la venta va a recuperar muy pronto el dinero que esta invirtiendo.

loan.use: To print new calendars and business cards for which he has pending orders

loan.name: Maura's Group

texts.es:
Dora and Maura have belonged to the Sumaq Wasi (â€œPretty Houseâ€) Communal Bank for 6 months.

Dora lives in a communal home. She is 43 years old and has 3 children. Dora and her husband have a business processing cereals and milk. They sell their products to different stores in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Dora sells cosmetics via a catalogue.

Meanwhile, Maura is married, 44 years old and has 2 children. Maura sells cereals, groceries and vegetables from her house.

Dora and Maura need loans of 600 soles and 1000 soles, respectively; money that will be invested in the purchase of soy, arverja (a vegetable used to make flour), quinua (a native grain), perfumes, sugar, rice, oil and cereals.

The dreams of Dora and Maura are to have a larger business, to offer a good education to their children and to have more supplies for their business.

Dora es conviviente, tiene 43 aÃ±os y 3 hijos, Dora junto a su esposo tienen un empresa de procesamiento de cereales y lÃ¡cteos, sus ventas lo realizan a las diferentes tiendas de la ciudad de ayacucho. AdemÃ¡s Dora vende cosmÃ©ticos por catÃ¡logo.

Mientras que Maura es casada, tiene 44 aÃ±os y 2 hijos, Maura vende cereales, abarrotes, verduras, en su casa.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosaria is a widow and has 2 sons who are 32 and 30 years old. She started her business because sometimes her children didnâ€™t have enough money to give her and therefore she didnâ€™t have enough resources to cover the household expenses. She says â€œI was in despair and had to find a way to start working and earn some money in the short termâ€.

Some years ago she started selling shoes, covers and other products. Now she sells shoes from a catalogue and the business is doing very well. Every month she has a big amount of orders as people always buy her shoes.

She now asks for a loan of US $475 that she will pay within a month. This loan will help her to pay a pending order and fulfill the obligation she has toward her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

MarÃ­a del Rosario es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya mayores de 30 y 32 aÃ±os. Todo comenzÃ³ hace alguno aÃ±os y desde entonces ha vendido calzado, colchas y otras cosas de las que se vaya pudiendo, ahorita esta vendiendo calzado por catalogo, y le esta yendo muy bien porque cada mes tiene gran volumen de pedidos y la gente siempre le compra.

loan.name: Rosalba Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rosalba is a widow and she started her business when her husband died. She had difficulties to cover the household expenses; she had to pay debts and to raise her family. She therefore decided to do something about it, to open her own business and to work hard.

She decided to open a gym as she had many acquaintances who did sports.

She started her business 15 years ago and she has been very successful. She has clients that go to her gym daily and even when she changed the location, they kept on going to her gym.

She now requests a loan of US $575 that she will pay within 6 months. She will use this loan to buy equipment for the gym.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosalba es viuda e iniciÃ³ el negocio cuando muriÃ³ su esposo tuvo que ponerse a trabajar muy duro ya que los gastos que tenia eran muchos demÃ¡s de muchas deudas y tenia que sacara adelante a su familia y no podÃ­a quedarse de brazos cruzados, por eso emprendiÃ³ su propio negocio y opto por abrir un gimnasio ya que tiene muchas conocidas que practican ejercicio.

ComenzÃ³ con el negocio hace mÃ¡s de 15 aÃ±os y desde entonces ha tenido mucho Ã©xito ya que tiene un gran grupo de mujeres que van a su gimnasio a practicar, a pesar de que he cambiado de direcciÃ³n la siguen buscando.

Solicita un crÃ©dito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses. Este crÃ©dito la va a ayudar para poder comprar equipo para el gimnasio.

loan.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
MarÃ­a de la Paz is married and has two children ages 13 and 10, both of whom are students. Her husband works as an employee of a business in their area. She started the business four years ago to contribute to the family expenses, as there were frequent money shortages. Four years ago she began selling household items by catalog, and now she buys packages and sells much more.

She requests a loan of $775, which she will repay over 6 months, to remodel her store and be able to exhibit more merchandise. With your help MarÃ­a will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

MarÃ­a de la Paz es casada y tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 aÃ±os, ambos son estudiantes. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de la localidad. Inicio su negocio para solventar los gastos familiares ya que las carencias eran muchas hace 4 aÃ±os inicio con la venta de artÃ­culos para el hogar por catalogo, actualmente compra por paquetes y vende muchos mas.

Ahora solicita un prÃ©stamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y poder exhibir mÃ¡s mercancÃ­a. Con tu apoyo MarÃ­a saldrÃ¡ adelante.

loan.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra C. considers herself to be a very serious, hard-working, and honest person. She is a widow and has four children: Margarito, 29 years old, studies and works as a secondary school teacher; Luis Gerardo, 27 years old, is employed; Martha Alejandra, 25 years old, is employed; and Blanca Estela, 23 years old, is married. Only Margarito and Luis Gerardo live with her.

She started her business because when her husband was alive, sometimes his work wasnâ€™t steady and she wanted to help him with the household expenses. She opened a grocery store in March 1985 when her husband was still alive. He worked as a clerk and she attended the store. As their house was on a busy street, they built a wooden store on the patio of their house. They have done well and her son Luis is a carpenter, and he has been expanding the store a little bit and now they are remodeling it because they would like to expand it.

She is requesting a loan of $400, to be repaid over 5 months, to purchase wood and paint, as well as have lettering done, which will make their store look more presentable and large to give their customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Solo Margarito y Luis Gerardo viven con ella.

loan.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores cooks and sells food. She is married and has 3 sons, who are 20, 18 and 14 years old. Her husband is a trailer driver. She started her business in order to help her husband with the household expenses as he does not have a fixed income.

She started her business 17 years ago in a small shop where she only sold fast food. She has ever since developed her business and she now sells complete meals.

She currently requests a loan of US $250 that she will pay in 3 months. With this money she will buy a 4-burner grill that she needs. She hopes that your help will make this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.name: Melania

texts.es:
SeÃ±ora Melania has made a living by making bread for one year. Her small bakery offers bread to everyone who lives inside and outside her community. She has dedicated herself to this business for one year. She also sells cosmetics and clothing.

DoÃ±a Melania is an enterprising, positive woman. She hopes in the future to be able to grow her business to the degree that she can make deliveries of bread to small grocery stores so she can capture new customers that value the quality of her products. As time goes by, she hopes to be able to diversify her products and reach new segments of the market. She will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies for her business.

La Sra. Melania se dedica a la elaboraciÃ³n de pan desde hace un aÃ±o, su pequeÃ±a panaderÃ­a les ofrece pan a todas las personas que viven dentro y fuera de su comunidad, la Sra. tiene un aÃ±o de dedicarse a este negocio, como actividad adicional tambiÃ©n se dedica a la venta de cosmÃ©ticos y ropa.

DoÃ±a Melania es una seÃ±ora emprendedora, positiva, espera que en un futuro su negocio pueda crecer al grado de hacer entregas de pan a las pulperÃ­as y por ende acaparar cada dÃ­a nuevos clientes que valoren la calidad de su producto, con el paso del tiempo ella espera lograr diversificar su producto y llegar a nuevos segmentos de mercado. El prÃ©stamo lo invertirÃ¡ en compra de materia prima para su negocio.

loan.name: Pablo

texts.es:
SeÃ±or Pablo M. M. is an elementary school teacher in one of the schools in Managua. He likes his profession because he feels that he is contributing to the intellectual and social development of children. He also likes to involve himself completely in the activities of his community, with the aim of contributing to the sports in his community to keep young people from vices and delinquency.

Don Pablo is single, is 49-years-old, and one of his biggest dreams is to someday see his house completely built and to live in a house worthy of all his efforts at work. He hopes to be able to use this loan to purchase construction materials to finish building a room. He will pay this loan back in 12 monthly installments.

El Sr. Pablo M. M. es profesor de primaria de uno de los colegios de Managua, le gusta su profesiÃ³n porque siente que contribuye con la formaciÃ³n intelectual y social de los niÃ±os, ademÃ¡s, le gusta involucrarse de lleno en las actividades de su comunidad con el fin de contribuir con el desarrollo del deporte de su barrio y de esa manera apartar a los jÃ³venes de los vicios y de la delincuencia.

Don Pablo es soltero, tiene 49 aÃ±os y uno de sus mÃ¡s grandes sueÃ±os es ver un dÃ­a su casa de habitaciÃ³n construida totalmente, para asÃ­ vivir en una casa merecedora de todos sus esfuerzos de trabajo. Espera poder utilizar el prÃ©stamo para la compra de materiales de construcciÃ³n para llevar a cabo la edificaciÃ³n de un cuarto. Este prÃ©stamo lo pagarÃ¡ en cuotas mensuales a 12 meses de plazo.

loan.name: Eva Maria

texts.es:

DoÃ±a Eva started her business with the goal of supporting her husband economically, and in this way, obtaining more income that would help solve their family expenses in a big way.

DoÃ±a Eva has 3 school-aged children. Her husband works in an upholstery business. Both work on their own, and until today, their businesses have grown positively. With effort, both have managed to take good care of their family and have improved their quality of life at the same time. One of her big dreams is to grow her business and obtain better equipment. DoÃ±a Eva needs this loan to invest in merchandise that she will later offer to her customers.

Uno de sus grandes sueÃ±os es lograr que su negocio crezca y de esa manera obtener mayores utilidades, doÃ±a Eva necesita de prÃ©stamo para invertirlos en mercaderÃ­a que posteriormente ofrecerÃ¡n a sus clientes.

loan.name: Fatima Rosario

MarÃ­a Esther has a small grocery store. Her husband works as a caretaker of a country house and they have four children, two girls ages 14 and 6, and two boys, ages 12 and 2. loan.name: NoemÃ­

SeÃ±ora NoemÃ­ is married and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She has a one-year-old boy. Her husband is a cabinet maker, and he helps her a lot with their homes expenses. She decided to work on her own with the goal of making more income.

loan.name: FÃ¡tima

DoÃ±a FÃ¡tima G. is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. Her husband makes a living by painting and doing body work on cars. Both work very hard to pay for their home's expenses.

La seÃ±ora iniciÃ³ su negocio con la venta de frutas y verduras, ahora tambiÃ©n se dedica a vender comidas y refrescos, el negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa de habitaciÃ³n y la comida la vende generalmente por encargos, ya tiene 13 aÃ±os llevando adelante su pequeÃ±o negocio. loan.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pablo M. is a hardworking, enterprising man. He likes to work for his community, collaborating in different activities within his neighborhood with the aim of obtaining benefits from institutions that support many of Managuaâ€™s poor neighborhoods.

Mr. M. currently runs a general store in which he offers his customers a great number of products. He is a 51-year-old, married father of an underage daughter. His wife is an elementary school teacher who is also the school principal.

One of Pabloâ€™s aspirations is to one day own a distributor where he could sell wholesale products, and of course provide his customers with better service. He is requesting a loan in order to finish constructing a room in his home. He will repay this loan in 12 monthly installments.

El Sr. M. actualmente tiene una pulperÃ­a donde ofrece una gran cantidad de productos a sus clientes, esta casado, tiene 51 aÃ±os y de el depende solamente una hija menor de edad, su esposa es profesora de primaria y se desempeÃ±a como directora de un colegio.

Una de las aspiraciones de don Pablo es llegar a tener un dÃ­a una distribuidora, donde pueda vender productos al por mayor y por supuesto darle una mejor atenciÃ³n a sus clientes. loan.name: Lucila

texts.es:
This client is a person who has worked in the public hospital in Managua for 10 years. She is an assistant nurse, is 56-years-old, and is married. Her children are adults and support her economically. Her husband is a taxi driver and also contributes to the financial well-being of their home.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in the construction of a porch or terrace. This will allow her family members to have a pleasant place to rest at the end of each day's work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Esta clienta es una persona que labora en un hospital pÃºblico de Managua desde hace 10 aÃ±os, ella es enfermera auxiliar, tiene 56 aÃ±os, es casada, sus hijos son mayores de edad y le apoyan econÃ³micamente, la profesiÃ³n de su esposo es taxista, quien tambiÃ©n contribuye con los gastos de la casa.

DoÃ±a Lucila tiene como meta de vida ver un dÃ­a su casa de habitaciÃ³n terminada, espera que con el esfuerzo de toda su familia y el apoyo de nuestra InstituciÃ³n pueda ver realizado su sueÃ±o como es tener una vivienda digna. loan.name: Umi

texts.id:
There are a lot of motorcycles passing by Kupaon street and this gave idea to Mrs. Umi F. and her husband to open a motorcycle repair shop which also sells motorcycles spare parts.

The shop opens everyday from 08.30 am to 05.30 p.m. and it has a lot of customers. This makes her overwhelm. She plans to use the loan money to buy more merchandises (spare parts) for her shop.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Begitu banyaknya sepeda motor yang melintas di Jalan Kupaon membuat Ibu Umi F. dan suaminya membuka usaha bengkel sepeda motor dan suku cadangnya seperti oli, busi, ban dan lain-lain. Ibu Umi F. membeli alat-alat bengkel dari supplier yang datang ke tokonya. Karena begitu banyaknya pelanggan Ibu Umi F. sampai kewalahan, karena pelanggannya bukan saja penduduk sekitar tetapi juga mereka yang kebetulan lewat di Jalan Kupaon. Kadang stoknya habis dan Ibu Umi harus mencari ke toko di wilayah Denpasar. Pinjaman kali ini rencananya akan dipergunakan sebagai tambahan modal untuk pengadaan suku cadang dibengkelnya. payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Mohammad Hayoub

texts.en: Mohammad Hayoub lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail shop and has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. Every day he works hard to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to enlarge his shop and buy more food items for his business. He is happy with this loan and he would like to thank lenders who help poor people around Afghanistan.

loan.use: To enlarge his shop and buy more food items

loan.name: Habib Allah

texts.en: Habib Allah lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a single boy who has a small tire repair shop where he works. He has a good number of clients and he wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to buy a new machine and complete some smaller purchases. He wants to make a good income to help his family and make a better future for himself.

loan.use: To buy a new machine

loan.name: Tum

texts.en: Mrs. Tum V. lives in Kampong Pou Village in Kandal Province and she is 47 years old. She is the mother of five children, two of whom attend school while the others are working. They can generate an income of around $4.25 per day. Her husband, Mr. Vann Nhim, is on the right of the photo; he has his own field and he usually works with his wife. Mrs. Tum V. and her husband cultivate many different kinds of vegetables but now they lack money to buy more seeds. Thus, Mrs. Tum V. decided to access a loan to buy vegetable seeds.
