loan.name: Sokchea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokchea P., 44, lives in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer and is married with four children. One child works in a garment factory, while the others are attending school. Her husband, Mr. Sok Soung, is pictured on the left in the photo. He is a farmer with a cultivatable field next to the village and can earn about $1.50 per day. Because of her poor living condition, Mrs. Sokchea P. doesnâ€™t have enough money to buy vegetable seeds, and thus she would like to apply for a loan.

loan.use: To buy vegetable seeds

loan.name: I Nengah Sedra

texts.id:
I Nengah Sedra is a diligent and tenacious farmer, who strives to meet his familyâ€™s needs. His wife does not work, and thus, he carries the burden alone through his farming income to meet his familyâ€™s needs. I Nengah Sedra works on a 1-hectare farm owned by his parents. His familyâ€™s daily expense is quite expensive especially since his children are still in school. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming equipment, seeds and supporting materials require a larger capital, which he didnâ€™t have. I Nengah Sedra is relieved that DINARI is helping him get a loan he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. I Nengah Sedra rents a tractor to till his farm because he doesnâ€™t have an ox to do the job. I Nengah Sedra is waiting for his next harvest, which he hopes to yield better results from his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his childrenâ€™s educational needs, and if there is still some money left, he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

I Nengah Sedra seorang petani yang sangat rajin dan ulet, semua dilakukan supaya ekonomi keluarga bisa tercukupi. Apalagi istrinya tidak mempunyai penghasilan tambahan sebagai pendukung keuangan keluarga. I Nengah Sedra hanya mengandalkan penghasilan dari pertanian untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. Sawah yang dikerjakan seluas 1 hektar dan itu pun masih menjadi milik orang tuanya. Biaya yang dikeluarkan setiap hari cukup besar apalagi anak-anaknya masih duduk dibangku sekolah. Sedangkan dari hasil panen yang diperoleh tidaklah maksimal karena dalam pengolahan tanah maupun pembibitan dan pemeliharaan tidak bisa dilakukan dengan maksimal,ini semua karena terbentur dengan modal. Tetapi sekarang I Nengah Sedra sudah merasa lega karena adanya pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari untuk menunjang usahanya dibidang pertanian. Modal tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit unggul,pupuk organik dan juga obat pestisida. Pengolahan tanah dilakukan dengan menyewa traktor, karena I Nengah Sedra tidak mempunyai sapi untuk membajak. Kini I Nengah Sedra sedang menunggu panen tiba, ia sangat berharap panen kali ini berhasil dan mendapat keuntungan yang meningkat dari panen sebelumnya. Keuntungan ini nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk menunjang pendidikan anak-anaknya dan apabila ada sisa I Nengah Sedra ingin sekali bisa memperbaiki rumahnya yang belum selesai dibangun.

loan.use: To buy quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loan.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn S. is a clothing seller and lives in Roteang Village in Kandal Province. She is 58 years old and is married with eight children. Three of the children are working and two others are enrolled in school; the others are too young to study or work. Her husband, Mr. Toun Teoun, who is on the left in the photo, is a farmer and can generate a small income.

Mrs. Horn S. usually faces a problem during the rainy season because no customers come to buy her products. The family typically spends money on vegetable seeds, as well as on Mrs. Horn S.â€™s business and everyday family expenses. In order to expand her business, she now wants to apply for a loan to buy more clothes to sell in the village.

loan.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loan.name: Kampong Svay Ii Group

texts.en: The Kampong Svay II group consists of twelve members, and Mrs. Bunthin S. is the leader. She is 40 and is the mother of four children, two of whom stuD.. The others stay at home. Mrs. Bunthin S. is a grocer and she also runs a lottery business in the village. Her husband, Mr. Meng Hong, is a house builder. Last year, her children fell ill, and to cure them Mrs. Bunthin S. spent around $10 for each child each time they were sick. She has had a loan from another microfinance institution, which she used to buy groceries to sell. Now she would like to request a loan to fix the ceiling of her house.

loan.use: To fix the ceiling

loan.name: Si Im Teim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Si Im T. is a group leader of a group with four members in Doeum Porpel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 25 years old and is the mother of two children, both too young to study or work. She is a grocer in the village; her husband, Chanroeurn Va, is a laborer who makes a small income to help support his family.

Mrs. Si Im T. has faced a problem with her business, because she doesnâ€™t have enough money to invest in inventoR.. Thus, she needs to request a loan to buy groceries to sell in the village.

loan.use: To buy groceries to sell

payment.comment: The two members in this group have finished the loan term already: Mrs. Si Im Teim and Sarim Ry repaid $150 each to finish the loan term. Additionally, Mr. Sophorn Teim has repaid $27 as an extra repayment.

loan.name: Pann

texts.en:
Mrs. Pann M. is 57 years old and lives in Or Soursdey Village, Kompong Thom Province. M. sells groceries and earns about $2.33 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chan Samon, is 71 years old. He repairs motorcycles and bicycles, earning about $2.16 per day. They have five children, three of whom are married and two are single.

Because of the family's increasing expenses, M. sends one of her sons to work as a laborer outside the country and another one works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.

M. requests a loan of $700 to purchase grocery stock to sell, especially before Khmer New Year. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle. M. hopes this loan will help her support her family.

loan.use: To purchase grocery stock to sell and a motorcycle

loan.name: Ny Yun Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny Y. is a grocer and lives in Au village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is also the leader of a group with four members. She has four children, one of whom is a farmer and one of whom is enrolled in school. The two youngest are still too young to work or study. Her husband, Soth Pon, is a subsistence farmer. Their income comes principally from the sale of groceries and rice, and they use this income to support the family and pay for expenses.

This year, Mrs. Ny Y. has a lot of rice, but she does not have enough money to transport her rice and sell it for a better price. Thus, she would now like to have access to a loan to hire a car to transport her rice.

loan.use: To hire a car to transport her rice

loan.name: Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. Ton B. is a 55-year-old farmer who earns around $3.50 per day. She lives with her husband Sok Kuon and her five children in the Kork Srok Village, Siem Reap Province. Kuon, 45, makes $3 per day as a bricklayer. Some of their children are students, while others earn $2.50 per day as bricklayers.

To help sustain her business and expand for the future, B. seeks a loan of $400 to improve her farming business by purchasing more oxen.

loan.use: To improve her farming business by purchasing more oxen

loan.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma has been working in her little shop, located inside her home, for 15 years. When she moved to her present location, she thought that it would be a good idea to invest her time doing something productive that would improve her and her familyâ€™s then financial status. She has always considered herself to be a hardworking and enterprising woman, which is why she has stocked her shop with an assortment of products. Nine years ago, she started selling beauty products as well.

Additionally in her spare time, she maintains her small orchard, where she now harvests fruits such as lucmo (a subtropical Peruvian fruit), figs, and avocados. Perhaps she will also sell fruit sometime in the future; however, she would like to be able to expand her business space so that she can have more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace quince aÃ±os Vilma se dedica a atender en su pequeÃ±a bodega ubicada en su casa. Cuando se mudo a su actual vivienda ella pensÃ³ que seria buena idea invertir su tiempo haciendo algo productivo y que mejorara la situaciÃ³n econÃ³mica que en ese entonces su familia tenia. Desde siempre se considero una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, por ello ha ido implementando su tienda con diversos productos, es asÃ­ que desde hace nueve aÃ±os tambiÃ©n se dedica a vender productos de belleza.

Por otro lado, en sus tiempos libres se ocupa de darle mantenimiento a su pequeÃ±o huerto, donde ya puede cosechar algunos frutos, tales como la lÃºcuma, el higo y la palta. En un futuro se dedique tal vez a vender frutas tambiÃ©n; sin embargo, ella quisiera poder agrandar su local para poder tener mas mercaderÃ­a.

loan.use: Increase merchandise to boost sales

loan.name: Ceneida

texts.es:
Ceneida is a woman who arduously pushes her business daily so that it can progress. She is a mother of 3 children ages 11, 8, and 5. She, alongside her husband, is in charge of supporting her children and covering the household expenses.

She has been running her general store for 4 years, and at present, she sells practically everything. She and her husband previously used to sell clothing at a stand in a market, where they managed to establish their business, which operated for 8 years. Nevertheless, she felt the need to be closer to her children, who were still young at that time. For this reason, she decided to hand the clothing store over to her sister-in-law. While her husband went to work outside of Lima, she decided to open a general store in her home.

Lately, Ceneida has been planning to return to clothing sales, since she now has the help of a niece who would be in charge of minding her general store. This time, however, she would like to sell clothing door-to-door because she claims that it is more amusing this way.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ceneida es una mujer que, con arduo esfuerzo, empuja a diario su negocio para que avance hacia adelante. Ella es madre de tres niÃ±os quienes tienen 11, 8 y 5 aÃ±os. Junto a su esposo, se encarga de mantener a sus hijos y los gastos de la casa.

Hace cuatro aÃ±os que trabaja en su bodega y, hoy en dÃ­a, vende prÃ¡cticamente, de todo. Anteriormente a este trabajo, ella y su esposo se dedicaban a vender ropa en un puesto dentro de un mercado, donde lograron establecerse y en el cual paso ocho aÃ±os. Sin embargo, ella sintiÃ³ necesario estar mas cerca de sus hijos que en esa Ã©poca estaban muy pequeÃ±os aun. Es por ello que decidiÃ³ darle a su cuÃ±ada la tienda de ropa y mientras que su esposo se fue a trabajar fuera de Lima ella se animÃ³ a abrir una bodega en su casa.

Ãšltimamente, Ceneida planea volver al negocio de venta de ropa, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de una sobrina quien se encargarÃ­a de atender su bodega. Pero esta vez venderÃ­a ropa por reparto, ofreciÃ©ndolas casa por casa; ella dice que es mas divertido hacerlo de este modo.

loan.use: Invest in a new clothing business

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Twenty years ago, Rosa felt the need to do something to generate additional income (apart from her husbandâ€™s earnings), so she started selling what little she could offer to her customers. At that time, her children were still very young, and it is for them that she has been prospering in her business this whole time.

The majority of her children are now independent, which is why the profits gained from the business are basically for her and her husband, who is a retiree of the national police. Rosa R. suffers from diabetes, and she just underwent surgery for a diabetes-related complication not too long ago. Nevertheless, this illness does not weaken her. On the contrary, it fills her with more strength to be able to convert her shop into a bookstore in the near future because she considers this business to be more lucrative.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

EmpezÃ³ vendiendo lo poco que podÃ­a ofrecer a sus clientes. Hace veinte aÃ±os Rosa se vio en la necesidad de hacer algo para generar un ingreso econÃ³mico mÃ¡s (muy aparte que el que su esposo producÃ­a). En ese entonces, sus hijos aun estaban pequeÃ±os y por ellos es que durante todo este tiempo ha ido progresando en su negocio.

Actualmente sus hijos ya son , en su mayorÃ­a, independientes; es por ello que las ganancias que su negocio produce las destina bÃ¡sicamente para ella y para su esposo quien es jubilado de la policÃ­a nacional. Rosa R. sufre de diabetes y no hace mucho acaba de ser operada por una complicaciÃ³n de esta enfermedad; no obstante, esto no la debilita, al contrario, la llena de mÃ¡s fuerzas para poder convertir, en un tiempo, su tienda en una librerÃ­a; ya que considera es un negocio mas rentable.

loan.use: Restock her general store with a greater variety of products

loan.name: Block A North 2043-02 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Flora M.. Her current business is selling groundnuts. Flora is 33-years old, is married, and her husband is a security guard . She has 7 children ages 9 to 17, and all of her children go to school. Flora earns approximately 100 sudanese pounds a week selling nuts. She is requesting a loan so she can branch out in her business efforts and buy a motor-bike so she can offer transportation service. Flora is joined in her small group by Veronica E., Grace L., Charity F., and Margret J.. Veronica E. has sells vegetables and wants to contract a shop. Grace L. is currently operating a business selling breads and wants a loan to pay school fees. Charity F. operates a business selling beans and wants to construct a house to rent to others. Margret J. is currently in the business of sellng breads and is requesting a loan to construct an oven for breadmaking.

loan.use: To purchase a motor-bike for transportation services

loan.name: Block A North 2043-03 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Rebbecca J.. She is sells various items at a small shop. Rebbecca is 42-years old, married, and her husband works as a security guard . She has 4 children ages 5 to 24, and all of her children go to school. Rebbecca earnsapproximately 200 sudanese pounds a week, and she is requesting a loan to expand her retail business. Rebbecca is joined in her small group by Zuzela A., Jenifa A., Christine M., and Hellen P.. Zuzela A. has a business sells breads and wants a loan to pay school fees. Jenifa A. sells vegetables and wants a loan to pay school fees. Christine M. also sells breads and wants to open up restaurant. Hellen P. is sells sugar and is requesting a loan to construct a small shop.

loan.use: To expand business

loan.name: Heourn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heourn S., 33, is the group leader of a group of four members in Au Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a grocer in the village and she doesnâ€™t have any children. Her husband, Lor Kouk, is a driver who drives a motorbike with a cart and can generate a very small income to help meet the needs of his family.

Mrs. Heourn S.â€™s business faces an obstacle: many villagers buy her groceries on credit. Therefore, she doesnâ€™t have capital to invest in her business. At the moment, her husband's cart needs to be repaired, and she doesnâ€™t have money, so she decided to apply for a loan to fix the cart.

loan.use: To fix her husband's motorcycle cart

loan.name: Confort

texts.en:
Confort M. is a seamstress and also sells footwear and clothing material. She is married and has two children. She is working very hard to contribute to her familyâ€™s expenses. Business is going well and she wants to expand her business but lacks enough funds.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional funds to expand her business.

loan.use: Additional funds to expand her business

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 44045

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a trader who owns a provision store. She is married and has two children. Her husbandâ€™s income is not sufficient to meet the familyâ€™s financial needs. She is working very hard to support her husband in meeting the familyâ€™s expenses. She wants to increase her income.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more goods for resale

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44046

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is a trader who sells pastries. She is single and has no children. She is focused on expanding her business but lacks enough capital.

She is asking for $125.00 as additional capital to buy more materials for production and sale.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more materials for production and sale

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loan.name: Rotana Yart Group

texts.en: Mr. Rotana Y. leads a group of five members in Neang Mealea Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a 25-year-old farmer who cultivates many different kinds of vegetables. He is married to Mrs. Von Sok, who works in a garment factory and generates a small income that helps support her family. Rotana and Von do not have any children yet. They need their own house, so Rotana decided to apply for a loan to build a house in the village.

loan.use: To build a residential house

loan.name: Nusmira

texts.en: Nusmira was born in 1960 and she is a widow. She lives alone, near the town of Tuzla. Her monthly pension from her husband is 600 KM (about US$ 480). Nusmira wants to use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 for buying chickens in order to expand her little poultry business. Her wish is to improve food production and be able to fill her purchase orders.

loan.use: For buying chickens

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Mirela

texts.en: Mirela was born in 1974 and she is single. Her parents are employed and their monthly earnings are 1400 KM (about U$ 1125). The previous two loans that Mirela took at MCO WWI were in the amount of 500 KM (about US$ 400) and 1500 KM (about US$ 1200). This new loan, in the amount of US$ 975, Mirela wants to use for purchasing cosmetic products.

loan.use: For purchasing cosmetic products

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Hedija

texts.en: Hedija was born in 1961 and she is married . Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 1200 KM (about US$ 975). They have 3 adult children. This third loan in the amount of US$ 500 Hedija intends to use to buy fertilizer and other preparations needed for cultivation of her orchard. Although she is not employed, she wants to contribute to the household budget. She will feel more satisfied if she is doing something for her family.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer, etc. for their orchard

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 23, 2008)

loan.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mrs. Farida H. lives in Dhalko. Dhalko is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores, ready-made clothes shops and so on.

Mrs. H. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Amit H. and he is a taxi driver. Her son is studying in primary school.

Four years ago Mrs. H. opened her beauty-parlor to help her husband to upgrade the standard of living of her family. She took 6 months' training for the beauty parlor work from her friend. Her service is for ladies only. Now she is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy various types of make-up tools for her work. She wishes to spend her income to provide better education for her son.

loan.use: To buy make-up tools for her work

loan.name: Sahida

texts.en:
Mrs. Sahida H. lives in Dhalko. Dholko is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores, ready-made clothes shops, and so on.

Mrs. H. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Manjuro H. and he works in house construction. The living conditions of her family are not good because her husband has no regular work. So sometimes her husband doesnâ€™t have any income.

So as to overcome this problem, Mrs. H. opened her beauty parlor two years ago. She took 6 months' training for the beauty parlor work in a salon training institute in her locality. Her service is only for ladies . Now she is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy various types of make-up tools for her work.

loan.use: To buy make-up tools for her work

loan.name: Renu

texts.en:
Mrs. Renu M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters. Her husband's name is Birendra M. and he works in a carpet factory and her daughters are studying in grade five and grade one respectively.

Renu M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Thecho. She opened her shop a year ago. She opened her grocery shop to help her husband support their family. She sells different types of grocery goods like maize, rice, snacks, and so on from her shop. Now she is requesting for her first loan of US$ 175 to buy grocery items for her shop to meet the demand of her customers.

loan.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loan.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi S.,a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur lives in an extended family with her mother-in-law, brother-in-law, husband and one daughter. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. S. is a shopkeeper in Thecho. Her husband's name is Hira S. and he makes different types of handicraft goods. Her daughter is studying in primary school.

Mrs. S. opened her pots and utensils shop 3 years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. Her husband also helps her in her work. Now Mrs. S. is asking for her fourth loan of US$ 400 to further expand her shop by buying items like plates, steel glasses, and hotpots for their shop to meet the increasing demand of the customers. She wants to strengthen the economic conditions of their family by increasing her income.

loan.use: To expand her household products business

loan.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju G., a 40-year-old lady, lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming and running small businesses like grocery stores.

Mrs. G. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her older son works in a private office and her younger son is studying in grade 11.

Mrs. G. and her husband Mr. Shiddhi Bahadur G. opened their poultry farm 4 years ago. They sell chickens to the chicken dealers. They also sell chicken at retail prices in the local market. They are running their business successfully and they are happy with their income.

Now Mrs. G. is requesting her third loan of US$ 325 to expand her business to buy small chickens for her farm. They also want to expand the capacity of her farm.

loan.use: To expand her little poultry business

loan.name: Thuok

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuok N. is 28 years old and makes about $2.50 per day weaving large baskets to hold rice from her home in Kpub Reay Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. Her husband, So Sineth, is 26 years old and also earns $2.50 per day weaving rice baskets. They have one young child.

In order to enlarge her business, N. requests a $100 loan to buy more bamboo trees to make baskets. With the income generated by her business, N. can support her familyâ€™s expenses, as she plans to send her child to school when her child is 6 years old.

loan.use: To buy more bamboo trees to make baskets

loan.name: Shima

texts.en:
Mrs. Shima K. lives with her husband and two children in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. K. is a farmer in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. Due to the lack of new technology, she has to depend on seasonal farming. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and the evening. Now she is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

Mrs. Shimaâ€™s husband's name is Madan K. and he works in a private office. Their son is studying in grade 12 and their daughter is studying in grade 8.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm

loan.name: Kuku

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuku H. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. It is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in seasonal farming. Mrs. H. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband Mr. Kul Bahadur H. works in a private office. Her sons are studying in grades 10 and 5 respectively.

Mrs. H. is a wholesaler in the potato business. She sells potatoes cheaply in the local market. She buys potatoes from the Kalimati bazaar which is one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu valley. Now Mrs. H. is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 475 to buy potatoes for her business.

loan.use: To buy potatoes for her little business

loan.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanti C., a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishapati, lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Raj Kumar C. and he works in a private office. Her son is only one year old.

Mrs. C. is a farmer in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. She grows different types of vegetables in her farm. Due to the lack of technology, most of the farmers in this area depend on seasonal farming. Nepal is an agricultural country but new technology has not been introduced yet in farming. So the production of vegetables is not enough for the population of the country.

Mrs. C. sells her vegetables in the local vegetable market in the morning and the evening. Now she is requesting a loan of US$ 250 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her work.

loan.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loan.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipa K., a 35-year-old lady, lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Mrs. Dipa K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 10 and her son is studying in grade 6. Mrs. Dipa is a center chief in her group. Being a center chief she has take responsibility for her center members.

Mrs. Dipa and her husband, Mr. Ramesh K., opened their veterinary pharmacy 2 years ago. They sell different types of domestic animal medicine in their shop. They both contribute equally in their shop because they donâ€™t have any other job.

Now Mrs. Dipa is requesting her fifth loan of US$ 475 to expand her business and buy necessary medicine for her shop.

loan.use: To buy veterinary medicines for her shop

loan.name: Ieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Ieng C., 35 years old, and her husband Say Sareth, make around $3.50 per day farming near their home in the Suong District, Kampong Cham Province. C. has two children, one of whom works on a rubber plantation in Kampong Thom Province and contributes about $0.83 per day to the family.

C. seeks a $400 loan to purchase a water pumping machine for her farming business and a used motorbike for her husband. With this motorcycle, Sareth will supplement his income by working as a motorcycle taxi driver.

loan.use: To purchase a water pumping machine for her farming business and a used motorbike for her husband

loan.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn C. is 55 years old and a farmer in Ampil Phaem Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is married to Mr. Thou Nget, who is also a farmer; he is shown on the left in the photo. Morn C. is the mother of four children, two of whom are working in a garment factory, and one of whom helps the parents in the rice field. Another of the children is a construction foreman.
Mrs. Morn C.â€™s farm faces a problem with a drought and infertile land. Last year in October, her husband and children got malaria and went to a hospital, which cost $300. Thus, she now doesnâ€™t have money to buy her child construction equipment, and so she needs to ask for a loan to buy it.

loan.use: To buy construction equipment

loan.name: Hira

texts.en:
Hira R. lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Goam Bahadur R., and one son. She lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores. Her husband is a house painter. Her son is studying in grade 3.

Mrs. R. opened her small cafe 2 years ago to strengthen the economic situation of her family. She sells different varieties of food items in her little cafe. Especially, she prepares Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice) for her cafe. She also sells tea and coffee. Her cafe is small but very popular in her locality. So Mrs. R. is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy necessary food ingredients for her cafe.

loan.use: To buy food ingredients for her little cafe

loan.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba G. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 47 years old, married and has 3 children. She has finished high school. She is a seamstress by training. This is what she does now. Mahbuba works in an atelier where she sews traditional clothing. She has been doing this for 5 years. Now, that it is spring, there are more customers wanting to buy her products, this is why Mahbuba would like to increase volume of her goods. Mahbuba needs to buy cloth and ensure that her equipment functions well (fix her sewing machine). Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan amounting to $875, which will help her. Mahbuba plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

loan.use: Purchase cloth and repair the sewing machine

loan.name: Mirzo

texts.ru:
Mirzo P. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 44 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a university diploma. Mirzo is an engineer by training. Currently he does not work within his profession, but tries to feed his family by trading.

Mirzo has a place at the city market where he sells spare parts. He has been in this business for 5 years. His business helps customers obtain goods without having to leave the city and traveling to Dushanbe. In order to increase profits the client needs to raise the variety and number of goods that he offers. He brings goods from Dushanbe where he buys spare parts from wholesalers. Additionally, Mirzo would be able to increase the variety of products he offers and to meet customer needs. In order to reach his goal the client would like to obtain a loan; this is why he approached our organization.

Mirzo has a large and friendly family; they all try to help each other. He plans to repay the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

loan.use: To purchase spare parts

loan.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old, married and has 2 children. She has a high school diploma, and she is seamstress by profession. Marhabo works in an atelier where she sews traditional clothing. She has 5 years of experience in this area.

Now Marhabo would like to purchase her own sewing machine and cloth in order to start her own business. But she does not have the money to do this. This is why Murhabo came to us for help. She would like to obtain a loan that would help her reach her goals. If she starts her own business she would be able to improve financial situation of her family. Additionally, customers would be able to obtain services of an experienced seamstress at affordable prices. Marhabo plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

loan.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loan.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Mastura H. lives in the region of Shahrinav. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 children. She has a high school diploma and a professional specialization. She is a cook. Mastura works at the "Dekhon" market in her region. She has a small cafe where she works as a cook. This job brings profits that give her an opportunity to provide for the family.

Now Mastura would like to expand her business. She needs to rent a new location and to buy flour wholesale. This will help her improve the quality of service and to keep prices low, because flour prices keep rising. In order to reach her goal Mastura needs a $875 loan. She will be able to repay it within 9 months. Despite her age, Mastura is a very active and cheerful woman. Her clients love her and are always happy to visit her cafe.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

loan.use: To purchase flour and rent a new cafe location

loan.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline A. is 43 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigerian. Mrs. A. sells provisions, cooked food and drinks in her local community. She has been in this business for several years. She is requesting a loan of $1200 so she can buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. With this she hopes to better serve her customers. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loan.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs and drinks

loan.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat A. lives in the Shahrinav regions of Tajikistan. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a close and supportive family. Saodat manages her own business - she sells groceries in her own store. She brings the goods from Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan, and sells them in her home town. Saodat sells her goods with very little mark-up and as a result she has many customers. Currently Saodat wants to expand her inventory so that she can keep up with the local demand for various grocery products. To reach her goal she has planned to take out a loan. Saodat is going to pay back the loan in the next 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

loan.use: Expanding inventory

loan.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat S. lives in the Shahinav region of Tajikistan. She is 44 years old, married and has 3 children. Her family is very close and they own a business together Saodat and her husband own a market stall where they sell groceries. Her husband supplies the goods which he brings from Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. Saodat herself manages the stall and sells the goods. This business is the sole source of income for their family. Saodat and her husband have decided to expand the inventory so that they can increase their profits. However, they need a loan to reach their goal. They are planning to pay back the loan in the next 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

loan.use: Expanding inventory

loan.name: Rose

texts.en: â€œI love my kind of business. It gives me joy and also allows me to help my family,â€ says Mrs. Rose U.. Mrs. U. is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling drinks for the past 10 years. She is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more drinks for her business. She appreciates and says thanks to all who will make her loan possible.

loan.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is 39 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO member for seven years. Mrs. M. sells drinks in her community. She is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more drinks for her business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loan.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loan.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael I. is a strong and energetic woman. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and single. She sells and rents VCDs and cassettes to people in her community. She has been in this business for 2 years. Ms. I. is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more VCDs and cassettes for sale. This will help her improve her business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loan.use: To buy more VCDs and cassettes for rent and sale

loan.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina B. A. is a trader who owns a general store. She is married and has six dependents. Business is going very well and she wants to increase her sales but she lacks enough capital.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more goods for sale

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44076

loan.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. is a trader who sells tin tomatoes and other food items. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Hawa wants to increase her income to support her husband.

She is asking for $425.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more goods for sale

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 44077

loan.name: Xoname

texts.en:
Xoname A. prepares food for sale. She has two children. She is married to a mechanic whose income is too small to meet the familyâ€™s financial needs. Business is going well and she wants to increase her income to help support her husband.

She is asking for $525.00 as an additional capital to buy more food items for her food production and sale.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more food items for her food production and sale

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44078

loan.name: Emokpae

texts.en: Mr. Emokpae P. is 37 years old, married, and has a child. He hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells notebooks and textbooks. He has been in this business since 2001. Mr. P. is requesting a loan of $875 to enable him to buy more notebooks and textbooks for sale. He thanks you.

loan.use: To buy books for sale

loan.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. sells corn and palm oil. She is married and has one child. Demand for her goods has increased but she lacks sufficient capital to enable her buy more goods for sale.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more corn and palm oil for sale.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more corn and palm oil for sale

payment.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44080

loan.name: Fatuma Nasur`s Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 28, is the leader of this group. Fatuma is married with four children. They are aged 13, 11, 8 and 1.7 years old. The three oldest children are in school. Fatuma has just taken a loan for Shillings 800,000/=. She will use the loan to increase her stock of clothes and shoes. She hopes the increased profits will add to her savings so she can rent a shop in Kampala City Center.
The community she lives in is semi-urban. The challenges she faces are the long distances she has to travel to get to her different distribution points, fatigue, staying away from home for most of the week and carrying her baby with her.
Her children are able to go to boarding schools because of MCDT loans. She is also able to get the basic needs met for her family. Fatuma has also contributed to the procurement of a plot of land outside Kampala and has bought a motorcycle for public hire. She plans to rent a shop in Kampala City Center in order to reduce on the number of days that she stays away from home. Fatuma has paid over ten loans back successfully to MCDT.

loan.use: To purchase new and secondhand clothes and shoes

loan.name: Emumuwean

texts.en: Emumuwean J. resides in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old, married and has 5 children. She bakes snacks with her husband and also sells foodstuffs, provisions and drinks. She worked with Rayman Bakery for 3 years before she started on her own in 1995. Mrs. J. is focused and determined to enlarge her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more baking material and foodstuffs for her business. This will help her to better serve her customers. She thanks all who will make her loan possible.

loan.use: To buy more bakery material and foodstuffs

loan.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana K. sells corn. She is married to a farmer and has five dependents. Her husbandâ€™s income is not enough to be relied upon. She is working very hard to contribute to the familyâ€™s finances. She wishes to increase sales but lacks enough fund to buy more goods.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more corn to sell.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more corn for sale.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44083

loan.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. prepares food for sale. She is single and focused on expanding her business. Demand for her food has increased and she wishes to increase production.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more raw materials for her food production.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more raw materials for her food production.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44084

loan.name: Fatuma Nababiâ€™S Group

texts.en: Fatuma is 40 years of age and married with nine children. They are aged 22, 18, 16, 14,10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years old. All of them are in school. The community she lives in is semi-urban situated in a wetland that floods in the rainy season. She is paying back a loan for Shillings 1,000,000/=, which she used for increasing her stock and paying school dues. She hopes to raise more profits from the increased stock. Fatuma sells bananas for making a local food (matooke), and there is ready market for her merchandise The main challenges are working in the open space and residing in an area, which is prone to flooding. Her benefits include being able to take her children to school and fending for her family.. She also plans to buy a plot of land, build a house and move from the wetland. She would also like to shift to Kalerwe Market, where sales are deemed higher. All of her previous loans have been successfully repaid.

loan.use: To purchase more stock

loan.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with 2 sons. She and her family live in Novomoskovsk where Nadezhda runs a small business selling fresh meat and sausages at the central city market. This type of inventory always sells well as Ukrainian women love to cook and the cuisine in Ukraine offers many nourishing meals made with different meats. Nadezhdaâ€™s trade has been characterized by stability over the last 5 years. Presently, her business brings in about $300 a month in income.

Nadezhda has requested a loan to purchase new inventory items so she can continue developing her trade and feed her family. Additional financial assistance will help her to consistently build and manage her venture. We think Nadezhda, with her strong personality, high motivation, and passion to make a difference, will achieve success and repay the current loan promptly.

loan.use: Purchase new inventory

loan.name: Mary Nambalirwa`s Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of the group. She is 44 years of age and married with four children. They are ages 20, 18, 17, 15, years old. Three of them are in school and one dropped out due to lack of school fees. The community she lives in is urban in a slum wetland area that floods in the rainy season.
She buys clothes and displays them in the market and has done this since she joined MCDT. She will use her loan to purchase a bale of clothes. There is market for her merchandise because of her low prices. The main challenges are working in the open space and residing in an area, which is prone to flooding. Her benefits include being able to take her children to school and fending for her family. Plans include starting a wholesale shop for hardware and educating her children up to university level. Mary has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loan.use: To buy a bale of clothes.

loan.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku D. is a pharmacist. He is married and has three children. Business is going well and he wishes to increase his inventory but lacks enough capital.

He is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more drugs for his pharmacy.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more drugs for his pharmacy

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)
Correction due to underpayment for business 44088

loan.name: Florence Kyaligonza`s Group

texts.en:
Florence is the leader of the group of five members. She is 48 years of age, a single mother with two children in school. The community she lives in is urban in a slum wetland area that floods in the rainy season. Her main challenges are high transport and renting costs, stiff competition, working in the open space and residing in an area, which is prone to flooding.
The benefits of her loan program include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family and she was able to buy a plot of land Her plans include building a house with the money she earns from selling fuel and firewood.
Mary has successfully paid back 3 MCDT loans.

loan.use: To increase stock

loan.name: Imelda Bulwadda`s Group

texts.en:
Imelda is the leader of a group with five members. She is 56 years of age and she is a widow with six children. They are ages 35, 33, 31, 25, and 23 years old (with a pair of twins). Two are in school and the rest are working. The community she lives in is urban in a slum.
Her main challenges are petty thieves in the area, limited space to accommodate clients and the rainy season flooding the area. However, there is a ready market for her businesses.
Her benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family and being able to expand her business with the help of MCDT loans. She plans to grow her business by opening up a new eating-place.
Imelda has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loan.use: Opening a restaurant and selling soft drinks

loan.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero I. is a strong woman. She lives in Benin City, where she sells cooked food, provisions and drinks to people in her community. She has been in this business since 2005. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. Mrs.I. is requesting a loan of $450 so she can buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loan.use: To buy more provision and drinks for sale.

loan.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel E. is 37 years old, married and has a child. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling wood in her community since 2001. Mrs. E. is requesting for a loan of $1200 so she can buy more wood for her business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loan.use: To buy more wood for sale

loan.name: Sumiini Nabakiibi`s Group

texts.en:
Sumini is the leader of a group of five members. She is 40 years of age, married, with five children. They are ages 25, 23, 21, 19 and 17 years old. All are in school. The community she lives in is urban in a slum.
The main challenges are the high prices of commodities. There is ready market for her businesses and her clients include people retiring from their working places to their homes. Her benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family, and being able to build a 4-room house.
She plans to use her loan to expand her business and buy materials for constructing a house.
Sumini has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loan.use: To expand business and buy materials for constructing a house

loan.name: Ngozi

texts.en: E. Ngozi is 27, married, and has 2 children. She is a fashion designer, and she sews in several different styles. Mrs. Ngozi has been a fashion designer since 2000 and she is determined to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 so she can buy more cloth and tailoring materials for the business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loan.use: To buy more cloth and tailoring materials.

loan.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline E. is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells medicinal drugs and drinks. She has been a client of LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Mrs. E. is requesting a loan of $600 so she can buy more medicinal drugs and drinks for her business.

loan.use: To buy more medicinal drugs and drinks for sale

loan.name: Harriet Nansubuga`s Group

texts.en:
Harriet is the leader of a group of five members. She is 49 years of age, and a single mother with five children. They are ages 30, 28, 23, 18 and 20 years old. Three are in school and 2 are working. The community she lives in is semi-urban.
Her main challenges are the high prices of the vegetables especially in times of scarcity. Her commodity is a perishable and she has to be in the market as early as 4.00am to buy produce from the farmers. However, there is ready market for her vegetables.
She used to sell cold drinks and tea in the taxi park before switching to selling vegetables. The benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family, being able to acquire household assets.
She plans to use her loan to expand business by opening a hardware shop and building a house.
She has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loan.use: To increase her stock of vegetables and open a hardware shop

loan.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica E. is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. Mrs. E. sells bread. She has been in business since 1993 and has been a member of LAPO for the past 6 years. She is requesting for a loan of $600 to buy more bread for sale.

loan.use: To buy more bread for sale

loan.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen C. is 36 years old, married and has a child. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and sells wine, drinks, and provisions. She has been in business for 8 years. She is requesting for a loan of $450 so she can buy more provisions for her business. With this she will be able to better serve her customers.

loan.use: To buy more provisions, wine, and drinks for sale

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy U. is married and has 6 children. She is 48 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling foodstuffs and provisions in her shop since 1989. Mrs. U. is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a refrigerator for cooling drinks. In addition, with this loan she will be able to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loan.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs, and a refrigerator

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a diligent mother of 2 young daughters. Her greatest wish is to provide her beloved offspring with a higher education so that they may carve out an exceptional future for themselves. With this aim in mind, this industrious woman eagerly sells orange juice on one of the most crowded streets in the city of Juliaca. Now that her young ones have started elementary school, she feels the need to look for a way to generate more income in order to support them and pay for their studies. For this reason, she plans on expanding and improving her facilities in order to offer her customers more comfort and security. In order to substantiate those plans, Nancy needs the help of your generous heart, and is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy es una diligente madre de 2 pequeÃ±as niÃ±as, su mayor anhelo es brindarles estudios superiores a sus queridos retoÃ±os con el fin de que a travÃ©s de el puedan forjarse un futuro prodigioso, con ese objetivo en mente Ã©sta diligente mujer se dedica con mucho mÃ¡s ahÃ­nco a su negocio de venta de jugo de naranja en forma ambulatoria, en una de las calles mÃ¡s concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca.Ahora que sus pequeÃ±os niÃ±os iniciaron sus estudios primarios se ve en la necesidad de buscar la manera de generar mayores ingresos para su manutenciÃ³n y educaciÃ³n, es por ello que tiene pensado ampliar y mejorar su pequeÃ±a instalaciÃ³n para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor comodidad y seguridad.Para concretar sus planes Nancy requiere de la ayuda de tu generoso corazÃ³n y te hace la peticiÃ³n de un prÃ©stamo.

loan.use: Capital for improving her service

loan.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is thirty-four years old, married and a mother of two children. Her children are currently in school. She has been selling oranges in Mankessim, a fishing community, for twelve years. Ophelia wants to use her loan to purchase more bags of oranges so that she can supply to other retailers. It would also help her get a discount when she buys in bulk.
She is a member of the group called St. Jude. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loan.use: to buy more bags of oranges

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Michael E

texts.en: Michael E Usiaghan is married with 3 children. He is 48 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. Mr. Usiaghan has been publishing and selling books since 2004. He is requesting a loan of $450 so he can buy a printer for his business. He thanks you in advance for your help.

loan.use: To buy a printer for my shop

loan.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a married woman with five children. Her children are currently in school. She is forty-three years old and has been preparing and selling owaakye (brown rice cooked with beans) in Mankessim for the past ten years. It is a very nutritious dish eaten by almost all Ghanaians. It is in very high demand. Salamatu says that prices of her ingredients like spices, vegetables, beans and rice have gone up. She wants use her loan to buy her products in larger quantities to avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called St. Jude. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loan.use: to buy more rice, beans, vegetables, etc.

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Dorothy Namata`s Group

texts.en:
The main challenges are the fast perishing of these vegetables in the extreme conditions of heat and coldness, selling along the roadside in open space and having to be in the market as early as 4.00a.m in the morning to buy them from the farmers for resale. There is ready market for her business but profits reduce during times of surplus harvests.
Her benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family and paying rent for residential and work places and built a three-roomed house.
Plans to expand business by opening a retail shop construct a semi-permanent wooden structure to work from and build a house in order to stop paying rent.
She has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loan.use: To increase her stock of vegetables and fruits

loan.name: Natty

texts.es:
Nattyâ€™s greatest wish is to become a successful professional so that her beloved parents can be proud of her. With this goal in mind, she works hard daily and tries to do her best in all of the activities in which she is involved. Natty is originally from the province of Macusani, but over 6 years ago, she moved to Juliaca, where she is obtaining her professional degree thanks to her dear parentsâ€™ support. A few years ago, after much discussion, they decided to open a mini market, which helps them meet their most urgent needs and pay for her studies. Upon seeing the demand and the ever-rising cost of basic foodstuff, they would like to increase their stock. They believe that with this investment, they will be able to increase their earnings and keep the prices down for better customer satisfaction. Your indispensable contribution will permit Nattyâ€™s plans to materialize.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El deseo mÃ¡s gran de Natty es convertirse en una exitosa profesional para que sus queridos padres se sientan orgullosos de ella, con este objetivo en mente se esfuerza a diario y trata de dar lo mejor de sÃ­ en cada una de las actividades que desarrolla.Natty es natural de la provincia de Macusani pero hace mÃ¡s de 6 aÃ±os radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar en el que estudia una carrera profesional gracias al apoyo incondicional de sus queridos padres. Hace algunos aÃ±os decidieron despuÃ©s de mucho diÃ¡logo abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes, tiendita con el que estÃ¡n logrando solventar sus necesidades mÃ¡s urgentes y su educaciÃ³n, ahora viendo la demanda y el elevado costo que dÃ­a a dÃ­a van adquiriendo los productos de primera necesidad desean aumentar el stock de su mercaderÃ­a, consideran que haciendo esta inversiÃ³n lograrÃ¡n mejorar sus ingresos econÃ³micos y mantener los precios para mayor comodidad de sus clientes.â€œTu indispensable aporte permitirÃ¡ concretar los planes de Nattyâ€

loan.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity of basic foodstuff

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44105

loan.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate I. is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria. Mrs. I. is a hair stylist who has been in business since 2005. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy weavons for her business. She will also buy a generator so she can work any time, as the electric supply where she lives is not regular. She thanks you in advance for the help.

loan.use: To buy weavons and a generator

loan.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is a cheerful woman who is much-loved by her family and in the workplace. She is originally from the district of Arequipa, but due to work issues, she now lives in the city of Juliaca. She finished her technical degree, but because of the lack of job opportunities, she is not able to put her profession into practice. A few years ago, she and her husband separated. Now, this diligent mother of a charming 8-year-old girl decided to sell party gowns and suits. Thanks to her patience and her wide selection of the most exclusive styles, her shop is now greatly frequented, allowing her to considerably improve her profits. Lidia plans on purchasing a greater variety of party accessories and exclusive gown and three-piece suit designs, with the aim of satisfying all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia es una mujer muy alegre y querida dentro de su entorno laboral y familiar, es natural del departamento de Arequipa pero por cuestiones laborales radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, terminÃ³ una carrera tÃ©cnica pero por falta de oportunidades de trabajo no puede desenvolverse.Hace algunos aÃ±os se separÃ³ de su esposo y actualmente esta diligente madre de una encantadora niÃ±a de 8 aÃ±os decidiÃ³ alquilar un local y poner su tienda de alquiler y venta de vestidos y trajes para fiestas, gracias a la paciencia con la que atiende y a la selecciÃ³n de los mÃ¡s exclusivos modelos de vestidos con los que cuenta en su establecimiento, estÃ¡ siendo muy concurrida y visitada, permitiÃ©ndole mejorar considerablemente sus ingresos econÃ³micos.Lidia tiene pensado adquirir mayor variedad de accesorios para fiestas y diseÃ±os exclusivos de vestidos y ternos, con el fin de complacer a todos sus clientes.

loan.use: Increase capital to purchase a greater quantity of apparel to satisfy her customers

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44107

loan.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty O. is a mother with three children. She is thirty-nine years old and has been selling second hand clothing in Mankessim for the last three years. She travels to Accra every three days to buy the clothes. Gifty wants to use her loan to purchase more bales of clothing to reduce her frequent travel to Accra and also avoid price hikes. This will allow her to save some money. She a member of the group called Lamb of God. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loan.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothing

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia has always been a very responsible woman. Despite the difficulties she has faced in life, she has never given up on moving forwards with her two children, who are her reason to live. This selfless mother currently lives with her children in a small, rented house in the city of Juliaca, which is where she decided to set up her small grocery store. Thanks to the range of products and, above all, to the good service she offers, she managed to gain a set of regular customers within a very short period of time. Her customers are now asking her to enlarge her store so that she can offer other products such as fruit and vegetables. With this project in mind, Antonia is coming back to ask if you can grant her the loan to turn her project into a reality.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Antonia siempre ha demostrado ser una madre muy responsable, pese a los momentos difÃ­ciles que le ha tocado enfrentar en la vida, nunca ha perdido la esperanza de seguir adelante junto a sus 2 hijos quienes son la razÃ³n de su vida. Esta Abnegada madre actualmente vive junto a sus hijos en una pequeÃ±a casita alquilada en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde decidiÃ³ abrir e implementar poco a poco su bodeguita de abarrotes, gracias a la variedad de productos que ofrece y sobre todo a la buena atenciÃ³n que brinda en corto tiempo logrÃ³ obtener asiduos clientes, clientes que ahora le solicitan ampliar su tiendita para ofrecer otros productos como verduras y frutas.Con ese proyecto en mente doÃ±a Antonia recurre a ti a fin de solicitarte un prÃ©stamo y posibilitar su proyecto.

loan.use: Increase in working capital to expand the range of products.

loan.name: Eseosa

texts.en: Eseosa O. is 32 years old, married, and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells lengths of cloth called wrappers that are worn by wrapping them around the body. She has been in business since 2003. Mrs. O. is requesting a loan of $700 to help her buy more wrappers. She is grateful to all who will make the loan possible.

loan.use: To buy more wrappers for sale

loan.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia is a very caring woman, as voiced by her friends and clients. She is very hard-working, cheerful and enterprising. Through hard labour she raised her children by herself and they have grown to become profesional and self-supporting men. This exemplary mother currently has a small space, selling groceries in one of the most busy avenues in the city of Juliaca. Her business manages to cover her most basic needs, as well those of her elderly mother. She is now returning to ask for a loan so that she can expand her range of products, including soft drinks. Eusebia expects her economic situation to improve as a result of this investment.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

DoÃ±a Eusebia, como cariÃ±osamente la suelen llamar sus amigos y clientes, es una mujer muy trabajadora, alegre y emprendedora, sola ha sacado adelante a sus queridos hijos y con su ardua labor los ha convertido en excelentes profesionales y hombres independientes.Esta ejemplar madre actualmente tiene un pequeÃ±o espacio de ventas de comestibles en una de las avenidas mÃ¡s concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, negocio con el que esta logrando cubrir sus necesidades mÃ¡s urgentes y la de su anciana madre, en esta oportunidad recurre a ti para solicitarte un prÃ©stamo para aumentar la variedad de sus productos y ofertar tambiÃ©n bebidas gaseosas, Eusebia cree que con esta inversiÃ³n mejorarÃ¡ sus ingresos econÃ³micos.

loan.use: Capital injection to expand her range of products.

payment.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44111

loan.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah has been selling gari (milled and roasted cassava), salt, maize and earthenware bowls in Mankessim for the past eight years. She is thirty-four years and a mother of three children. Her children are all currently in school. Hannah wants to use her loan to purchase more maize, gari and earthenware bowls for the lean season. This would enable her to avoid price hikes which affect the other products she sells. She is a member of the group called Lamb of God. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loan.use: to buy more gari, salt and earthenware bowls

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells food stuffs. She is married and has four dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Esi is working very hard to contribute to the familyâ€™s expenses.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more food stuffs to sell.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more food stuffs for sale

payment.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44113

loan.name: JosÃ©

texts.es:
JosÃ© has always had a special talent for cooking and currently expresses it in each one of his delicious stews, which charm the palates of his demanding clientele. The knowledge that he has gained and now puts into practice is the result of training from his adorable mother. Unfortunately, JosÃ© wasnâ€™t able to complete his high school education as he comes from a family with little economic resouces. However, in the preparation of delicious meals, he found his way to move forward, together with his two lovely children. He currently rents small premises which he runs as a restaurant. His much bigger wish, which lies at the bottom of his heart, is to have his own premises so that he can provide more comfort to himself and his demanding clientele. With this goal in mind, he is putting most of his effort into the preparation of every dish he prepares so that he can gain more clientele and increase his family income and his childrenâ€™s quality of life.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Don JosÃ© siempre tuvo un talento especial para la cocina, actualmente ese don lo plasma en cada uno de los deliciosos potajes que prepara para deleitar el paladar de su exigente clientela. Los conocimientos que aprendiÃ³ y ahora pone en prÃ¡ctica son productos de las enseÃ±anzas de su adorable madre, lamentablemente no pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios porque provenÃ­a de una familia de escasos recursos econÃ³micos, pero encontrÃ³ en la preparaciÃ³n de deliciosos platillos la manera de salir adelante junto a sus dos queridos hijos.Actualmente tiene un pequeÃ±o local alquilado en donde funciona su restaurante, el deseo mÃ¡s grande que alberga su corazÃ³n es tener su propio local para su mayor comodidad y la de su exigente clientela, con ese propÃ³sito en mente pone su mayor esfuerzo en la preparaciÃ³n de cada platillo que prepara para asÃ­ incrementar su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos econÃ³micos y la calidad de vida de sus queridos hijos.

loan.use: Capital injection to set up a restaurant in his own premises.

loan.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is thirty-three years old, married and a mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She sells onions, beans and sugar in the Mankessim market.
Efua wants to use her loan to buy more sugar, beans and onions to avoid price hikes and reduce her frequent travel to Takyiman, which is in the northern part of Ghana, for her products.
She is a proud member of the group called â€œGyedzi,â€ which means believe. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loan.use: to buy more onions, beans and sugar

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loan.name: Comite KoÂ´e Pyahu Group

texts.es:
This group from Barrio San Juan Miguel, district of Cambryeta was created from another group in the same neighborhood. The required meeting to put this group together was done and currently it is composed of 16 hard-working women.

These ladies' activities consists of: convenience stores, dressmakers, general merchandise retail, fruits and vegetables sellers, fabric and clothing retailers, photocopiers, street market retailers and others.

Each applicant receives the amount od 530,000 Gs. This money will be applied to expand their businesses, in other words, to purchase more merchandise and goods such as, clothes and shoes, purchase seeds for cultivation, purchase flour, baked pastries, canned goods, rice, noodles, dairy and assorted beverages; purchase fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners, elastic, zippers and others.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Este comitÃ© del Barrio San Juan San Miguel del distrito de Cambyreta ha surgido por contacto de otro grupo formado en el mismo barrio. Se han realizado las reuniones requeridas para la conformaciÃ³n del ComitÃ© y actualmente el mismo esta integrado por 16 mujeres trabajadoras.

Las actividades de estas seÃ±oras consisten en: despensas, costureras, venta de mercaderÃ­as varias, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de telas y ropas, fotocopiadora, puesto de ventas en la feria, y otros.

Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de 530.000 Gs. El destino de estos crÃ©ditos son para ampliar sus negocios, es decir para la compra de mas mercaderÃ­as e insumos como ser: telas, hilos, botones, elÃ¡sticos, cierres, harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas, prendas de vestir, calzados, semillas para cultivar, etc.

loan.use: Purchase clothes and shoes; purchase seeds for cultivation; purchase flour, baked pastries, canned goods, rice, noodles, dairy and assorted beverages; purchase fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners, elastic, zippers and others

loan.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate P. sells second-hand clothing. She is married and has three children. Her husband drives a commercial vehicle and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She is helping her husband with the family expenses. She wishes to increase her income but doesn't have enough capital.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loan.use: Additional capital to buy more second-hand clothing to sell

payment.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44117

loan.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is forty-nine years old and a father of three children. He is married and has been preparing and selling herbal medicine in his community of Mankessim for the past thirty years. He wants to use his loan to prepare more medicine so that he can ultimately rent a store to sell his products. Currently, he hawks his products.
He is a member of the group called Stewards. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loan.use: to prepare more medicine and rent a store for his operations

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)
